html: We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...Job DetailsAs an analyst on the Client Experience team you will help lead and manage projects in a team-based setting, providing support to directors and clients. Primary responsibilities include the analysis and interpretation of data to support strategies in areas such as merchandising, shelving, assortment, and distribution. You will also have client-facing opportunities to develop solutions, create and deliver presentations, and conduct training workshops while gaining fantastic exposure to the CPG industry and the underlying dynamics between manufacturers and retailers.Kantar is a specialist growth consultancy. With over 1,000 analysts, thought leaders, software developers and expert consultants we help clients develop and execute brand, marketing, retail, sales and shopper strategies to deliver growth. Kantar owns market leading assets including PoweRanking, GrowthFinder, Global Monitor, RetaiI IQ, RichMix, XTEL and Marketing, Insights and Purpose 2020. We track 1200 retailers globally, have purchase data on over 200 million shoppers and forecast social, cultural and consumer trends across the world.KEY OUTCOMESDesign projects to address key business questions and develop actionable insights, solutions, and recommendations for clientsSupport clients on our proprietary suite of tools – this will involve database management, leading training sessions, running projects on behalf of clients, and regular testing of the softwareLead Fortune 500 clients in project initiatives and business development planning • Manage multiple projects alongside senior colleagues, from project proposal to insights deliveryCollect, interpret, and analyze data using in-house resources, third party providers, and/or custom research techniquesCreate statistical regression models around consumer behaviorPresent key findings to clients and internal stakeholdersProactively communicate to clients via email, web conference, phone calls, and on-site meetingsFurther develop knowledge and expertise across Consumer Packaged Goods categories and marketsKEY CAPABILITIESBachelor’s degree in any undergraduate majors with a minimum GPA of 3.4 •Strong interest in business, shopper marketing, consumer goods, and retailDetail-oriented with strong quantitative skills and analytical abilitiesLogical thought process and ability to effectively communicate information verbally and in writing • Leadership initiative and strong interpersonal skillsProblem solving and critical thinking skills – ability to synthesize large amounts of information to uncover compelling and actionable insightsLocationNorwalk, MerrittUnited States of AmericaKantar Rewards StatementAt Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. html: About UsOur dedicated team and awesome technology are disrupting the customer support space. Our SaaS platform replaces all of the convoluted systems, lines, and contact numbers of standard customer support with a stunningly simple SDK and Smart Actions – fingerprint, verification, real-time sharing (videos, photos, and screenshots) and effortless in-app texting - plus all data is encrypted, keeping customer data secure. We take the frustration out of customer support and in turn, provide a sleek, secure, and modern smartphone-era experience. Join our team as we revolutionize the customer experience!OpportunityWe are looking for a mission-driven and passionate Data Analyst to be a champion for data across internal and external ‘customers.' You'll move the business forward by working across all parts of the business, but primarily account management, product, and engineering. You will work to ensure data is consistent, accurate, and accessible to our customers and other UJET employees; you'll also be a master in data visualization and use your expertise to help teams make data-driven business decisions independently and with ease.In addition to your technical skills of mining, cleaning, and interpreting data, you'll use creative problem solving to find the most effective solutions to analytical problems. You'll build relationships with stakeholders across the company, as well as customers, and help infuse each team with the data they need to meet and exceed their objectives.ResponsibilitiesDevelop dashboards to monitor business and product performance (80+% of workload)Set business metrics that measure the health of our business and productWork with other data analysts, engineers, and product to ensure data parity between our BI Tool (Looker/Sisense) and the UJET Portal. The ability to stick to industry standards and innovate/add new metrics is a mustCollaborate with account management, product, engineering, and finance teams to translate business insights into decisions and actionsProactively find opportunities for growth and efficiency internal to UJET and for our customers' businesses. It is required to have the ability to present an organized and thoughtful business case for these opportunities/insights, while also being understanding that the recommendation may not be implementedManage data analytics, BI tools, dashboards and employ strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and qualityCollect required data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing ad-hoc reportsRetrieve information from primary or secondary data sources and work with Data Engineers to maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsReview data, reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problemsCollaborate with management to prioritize business and information needsFind and evaluate new process improvement opportunitiesRequirementsMinimum of 3 years of relevant work experience in an analytics role (not inclusive of time spent in academia/boot camps, personal projects, and internships)Experience working with customer service or workforce management analytics greatly preferredDegree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, engineering, or applied math preferred but not requiredAdvanced SQLThe ability to actively listen to internal and external stakeholders, respond back to them in the language of their use cases, and translate their needs to technical and non-technical internal stakeholders.Compliance ResponsibilitiesSecurity, data protection and compliance (SDPC) are paramount to the success of our partnerships. All roles at UJET require compliance with legal and regulatory requirements and acceptance and adherence to all policies and standards within UJET. Personnel acknowledges they are personally responsible for reporting any suspected violations or abuse and are required to complete SDPC training and fulfill role-specific SDPC responsibilities.Why UJET?In addition to our great team and disruptive technology, we offer our teammates a competitive compensation and benefits package, work/life balance, unlimited vacation, stock options, catered lunches Monday through Thursday, monthly game nights, and more!UJET is an Equal Opportunity Employer

html: Who we are: The Global B2C Sales team is Wayfair’s pre-sale customer support and solution engine. We use data to understand customer needs and marry this with the optimal solution, ranging from a chat bot to high-touch, personalized sales support. This is a key element of how we can increasingly delight our customers by providing them with a faster and better solution to their needs, while driving further affinity for our brand.What You’ll Do: Utilizing a combination of manual call listening and technology, identify specific behaviors as our sales agents (chat or phone) engage with our customers. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. html: Why TrueAccord?TrueAccord is a category-defining company. We combine machine learning with a human-based approach to transform debt resolution and to get people on the path towards financial health. Every year, more than 70 million Americans have negative experiences dealing with debt. We are changing this by providing personalized digital experiences that guide lenders and consumers through this challenging financial process.With a world-class leadership team, passionate team members, and proprietary predictive models trained on years worth of transactional data, TrueAccord is well-positioned to deliver on a huge opportunity: helping millions of consumers to regain and keep their financial footing while lowering the cost of doing business for creditors across many industries.The RoleTrueAccord’s Analytics team is responsible for driving our business forward with data. The Data Analyst will join a rapidly-growing team of highly motivated people who take the TrueAccord mission seriously and are determined to succeed. As with every position on the Analytics team, the ultimate objective of this role is the development and delivery of analyses to cultivate TrueAccord’s strategies and optimize performance.As an analyst on our team, you will take ownership of multiple complex/sensitive projects, using data and behavioral analytics to intimately understand the debtor population and what levers will affect cohort performance. You will conduct deep explorations into our data to identify trends, produce insights & build predictive capabilities. You will gather key insights around our product, operations, and performance and will deliver these to stakeholders to enable informed decision making. This is an exciting role that can have a real impact on TrueAccord's success.Summary of Responsibilities and Duties:Act as an Analytics product manager for TrueAccord’s internal and external business operations; Work closely with stakeholders in Client Success, Product & Engineering, Sales, Finance, and the call center to ensure that all tactical and strategic objectives are supported by the identification and hypothesis formationWrite clean and concise queries to manage large tables and extract the relevant data efficientlyUsing applied and behavioral analytics, build the appropriate models to analyze performance trends, understand the root causes and/or drivers, and generate actionable insightsRoutinely present findings, insights, and recommendations to key stakeholders within development of reporting and visualizations to support business operationsProduce accountability for business outcomes through KPI creation and monitoringEnsure data integrity through the development and use of system controlsRequirements:A minimum of 3 years of experience using quantitative data analysis to solve problems and drive performance is requiredFluency in SQL, along with strong proficiency in data visualization and storytelling, is necessaryAbility to build complex models, perform deep analyses, and turn raw data into useful information and actionable insightsA deep understanding of statistical analysis, modeling, experiment design, and common pitfalls of data analysisDemonstrated pattern of being analytically curious, drilling into root causes and business impacts to answer not only “Why” but also “So What”Ability to present complex information and deliver insights to non-technical business partners clearly and conciselyStrong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively, both in a team environment and across functionsAttention to detail and accuracy, while maintaining a solid awareness of the big picture, are extremely importantMust be able to work effectively with little direct supervision and in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities, and multiple deadlinesVery Nice To Have:At least 5 years of relevant analytical experienceBS/MS degree in an analytical discipline: finance, statistics, applied mathematics, computer science, etc.Experience in Financial Services industry-with major bonus points coming from relevant experience in the debt collections spacePrior experience providing data analysis solutions in a call center environmentCompetency with data visualization or business intelligence tools such BenefitsTrueAccord is a distributed company with a major presence in the San Francisco Bay area and Lenexa, KS. We offer a healthy work environment that continuously builds an inclusive and diverse culture where everyone is able to develop the best version of themselves. We are a dynamic group of people who are subject matter experts with a passion for change.We offer:*** Generous paid time off*** Paid training*** We promote work/life harmony*** Paid holidays*** Health, dental and vision benefits*** 401K with matchingOur teams are crafting solutions to big problems every day. title: Data Analyst

html: As a Healthcare Data Analytic Specialist, primary responsibility is to acquire and transform clinical and health data from Inovalon's technical platforms and databases to create impactful, dynamic, and insightful healthcare data analytics such as opportunity analyses, risk adjustment and predictive modeling, program evaluation studies, customer reporting, product development, and ad-hoc analytics.Duties and Responsibilities:Performs complex and detailed statistical analyses and modeling of clinical and operational data with outputs that are clear and relevant to the users;Participates in the design and development of statistical analyses and reports that explore and present large amounts of data to discover underlying patterns and trends related to quality, safety, and clinical performance;Works with information from a variety of sources, including the EHR, publicly reported quality measurement and reimbursement data, and other resources using a variety of highly-specific tool such as, but not limited to, SAS, R, SPSS, Stata, SQL or Tableau;Develop requirements for data mapping and data loading processes. Execute data mapping/loading requirements and reconcilement of such activities;Plan and design data integration strategies, develop intuitive designs, and build enterprise interactive dashboards with built in guided healthcare data analytics;Identify and research anomalies and outliers in data. Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data;Monitor and perform trend analysis for the company and research report on anomalies Maintain compliance with Inovalon's policies, procedures and mission statement;Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within Inovalon's Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position; andFulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon for the purpose of achieving operational and financial success of the Company.Maintain compliance with Inovalon's policies, procedures and mission statement;Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within Inovalon's Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position;Fulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon for the purpose of achieving operational and financial success of the Company;Uphold responsibilities relative to the separation of duties for applicable processes and procedures within your job function; andWe reserve the right to change this job description from time to time as business needs dictate and will provide notice of such.Job Requirements:2+ years of experience in data analytics, data science, or related field;Experience conducting statistical analyses and data mining using tools, such as SPSS, SAS, Stata, or Minitab;Experience with data management and visualization tools, such as SQL and Tableau;Possession of strong analytical / statistical skills used in evaluating and analyzing data;Strong organization skills and attention to details, comfortable working with minimum direction;Adaptable to changing organizational requirements and priorities and supportive of a diverse work force;Ability to collaborate with others in diplomatic, tactful manner, while exercising sensitivity and discretion as needed;Advanced PC skills (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio, and other programs); andExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Education:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field of study.Physical Demands and Work Environment:Sedentary work (i.e. sitting for long periods of time);Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force;Frequently or constantly to lift, carry push, pull or otherwise move objects and repetitive motions;Subject to inside environmental conditions; andTravel for this position will include less than 5% locally usually for training purposes.

html: Company VisionTo return $1B back to businesses by the end of 2023.The Role of Data SpecialistYou LIVE to produce accurate reports that give visibility to the business so that we can make decisions that drive us towards our mission of returning $1B back to businesses.The Reporting Specialist gathers, verifies, and manipulates data for report generation. This individual performs data entry, data aggregation, queries, and audits of data from different departments. He/she will look across data sets from multiple systems to create and distribute reports. This role will support multiple functions to drive overall productivity and better operational performance.ResponsibilitiesCompiles and organizes data to create reports from integrated and non-integrated systems across the organization.Makes suggestions to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of current reporting processes.Maintains knowledge of technology and systems to ensure proficiency.Runs queries of data to satisfy user needs.Creates presentations to communicate data in visual and written formats using online tools.Stays abreast of changes in reporting needs to make updates to standard reports.Reviews data to ensure accuracy and validity for reports.Consults with stakeholders to respond to ad hoc reporting requests.Reviews data entered into systems to ensure accuracy of data.Monitors validity of data provided to users to ensure data quality.Corrects errors and resolves discrepancies with data and reports to ensure data quality.Provides data entry assistance to the organization to improve efficiency.Confers with management to respond to questions and concerns from various business units within the organization in a timely manner.Desired SkillsExcellent Data Management SkillsExperience with dashboarding and reporting softwares/platforms (Klipfolio, Databox, Tableau, etc)Proficient in SQLProficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and other related applicationsKey Performance MetricsWe are a results-based team. The person in this position will be measured using key metrics and is responsible for ensuring that metrics are met. All employees have a 90-day evaluation after starting and then quarterly to review performance and core values alignment.Leaders have the visibility they need and the information is always accurateCandidate ProfileYou likely embody these characteristics:You do what you say you will doYou have an attitude of constant-improvementYou approach life with optimism and see the good in situations and peopleYou enjoy people and are able to communicate clearly, both verbally and in writingYou are tech-savvy and aren’t afraid to learn a new platformYou get energy by working with people and building professional relationshipsYou enjoy working within a system and aren’t worn out by routineYou are a problem solver and aren’t dependent on others to tell you how to move forwardYou make decisions with the interest of the client, company and team in mindYou are self-motivated to produce agreed upon resultsYou are not late to meetings.You have a spirit of flexibility and you’re willing and able to handle change quicklySchedule:The Reporting Specialist is a full-time, W-2 employee of Gravy working approximately 40 hours per week. While we have a flexible work environment, we do expect you to be available Monday through Friday, 8:30am to 5:00pm ET for meetings, communication and request you check-in at least every 2 hours during those times. Meetings would include, but not limited to, weekly management updates, weekly Gravy All Team, and bi-annual summits. Travel could include up to 15 nights per year (Meetings at the office, bi-annual summits, etc.)

html: Job detailsSalary$65,000 - $80,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionASHLIN Management Group is seeking a Data Analyst to join our team working with our data analytics team. This professional will start off working with ASHLIN’s cloud-based visualization platform, CompassBI, powered by Sisense, on visualizing descriptive statistics and other key performance indicators and building ASHLIN’s library of dashboard templates. Additional projects will include supporting our team of project specialist in developing deliverables to our clients, based research and analysis methods, using statistical models on business data collected in field. Candidates should also be comfortable preparing routine as well as ad-hoc business reports and PowerPoint decks to present the information to senior management and clients.Essential duties and responsibilities:· Develop visualizations using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI and/or Sisense· Use sophisticated data analysis methods to support project team in creating deliverable for client· Work with clients to devise methods to optimize data capturing schemes and overall program evaluation plan Perform statistical modeling (e.g. ANOVA) using statistical software applications such as R and SPSS· Work with Senior Database Architect(s) to develop analytical SQL queries and reports for tracking, trending, and interpreting business data· Perform ongoing data quality assessments, identify discrepancies/inconsistencies, and resolve them· Continually improve the end-to-end process of data collection, transformation, analysis, and reporting· Develop data management programs and forms for data entry and maintenance by end-users· Document data analysis and reporting architecture, designs, and write user guides· Other duties as defined by senior research teamQualificationsTo be successful in this position, the Data Analyst must have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in:§ Data analysis, involved in both primary and secondary research using data to arrive at decision pertaining to marketing strategies§ Ability to interpret complex data sets (quantitative and qualitative) into insights that lead to effective marketing strategies and frameworks§ Strong data analysis modelling, specifically the successful candidate must be able to:§ Conduct cross-tabular and ANOVA and other statistical analysis using R and/or SPSS§ Interpret results of statistical analysis output and draw insights in order to make recommendations to senior management what steps to take§ Present data, interpretation and resulting strategy in language that indicates a command of the material while at the same time making sense to lay persons who may not have a marketing and/or data analysis background§ Develop data reports using the following tools and technologies:§ MS-Excel (Pivot Tables, VBA, Power Pivot, H-Lookup, V-Lookup, Import/Export from/to external data sources)§ Online Dashboards (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Sisense)§ Expert level skills in the development of highly impactful PowerPoint slide decks§ Development of scheduled and ad-hoc reports and analysis.§ Working in a team environment with responsibility for delivery of timely and accurate business-critical reports and analysis:§ Self-motivated and proactive, willing to drive a program of work to successful completion,§ Strong oral/written communication, and presentation skills,§ Ability to work with highly sensitive information and preserve the confidentiality of the information,§ Detail oriented and capable of identifying and resolving data quality issues.In addition, the following are highly desirable:§ A minimum of 3 years’ experience with statistical analysis tools (e.g. R, SPSS)§ A background in market research, or related disciplines§ Working knowledge of relational databases (e.g. SQL)Position requirements include:§ At least a Bachelor’s Degree in Math, Probability & Statistics, or related data science field§ Master’s degree in any of the above disciplines is highly desirable, or MBA§ High proficiency with statistical analysis tools§ Only open to candidates US Citizens and Permanent Residents currently authorized to work in the USJob Type: Full-timePay: $65,000.00 - $80,000.00 per title: Product Data and Reporting Analyst

html: CBRE is looking for a Data Analyst to perform collection, cleansing, and upload of CMMS Data for a large technology client in Sunnyvale, CA. This is not a remote role.RESPONSIBILITIESPrimary Responsibilities: Coordinate the collection, cleansing, and upload of CMMS Data. Interact with customers and the system to facilitate the full lifecycle of Data Collection for CMMS Data. Participate on improvement projects to the systems used to facilitate the data collection processes. Perform analysis on data to resolve issues. Make necessary preparations to support the Data Collection and upload process.The role of Data Quality Analyst facilitates the life cycle of CMMS data collection for construction projects. The role maintains the content of dashboards and provides regular reports to stakeholders. The role takes requests and launches Data Collection projects. Each project is validated against the Data Quality Business Rules, then the role engages the correct resources to complete the validations. The role works with the requesters to make the required corrections to completion. The role will guide the data to the final upload. The role will participate in improvement projects for the systems that are used to facilitate the delivery of CMMS Data.The role prepares template, files, data, and other requirements to support the data collection and upload process. The role will also perform data analysis to determine the correct course of action for reported issues.The ideal candidate would be someone with passion for data quality and the value it brings to the business.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESThe Data Quality Program Manager keeps the Data Collection process and Data Quality issue resolution on track. This is critical because the data loaded in the CMMS is the basis for Maintenance activities. Data must be accurate and on time for the operation to keep a high degree of reliability.Specific ResponsibilitiesSupport the identification, anomaly detection, and cleansing of data from various sources.Track the progress of all Data Collection projects using dashboards.Create, update, and close bugs for all Data Collection projects.Update bugs as required to progress, communicate, and memorialize actions taken in each Data Collection project.Prepare templates, files, data and other requirements to support data collection, upload, and issue correction.Perform data analysis to determine options for reported data quality issues.Support alignment of data to the standardsInteract with internal customers regarding data and issue correction.General Role Requirements:Manage project action items and follow-up commsManage project schedules and track changesRecord meeting minutes and manage communications with key stakeholdersManage project documentation, revision control and sites pageBuild and communicate status reportsSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESNo formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. html: Who we areAt Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.OverviewThe Analytics teams at Criteo are black box openers. They unveil the magic of the Criteo engine for our local team and for our clients and partners, providing actionable insights and recommendations which help making informed business decisions, to generate more revenue for our clients and for Criteo. Their mission is to transform Big Data into Smart Data.Working closely with commercial and technical teams in our respective markets, we provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry in order to meet the objectives set by our advertisers, and we focus on delivering improvements that will have immediate and measurable impacts. We get to play with exciting technologies such as Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau and R to grow the portfolio of analyses that we offer to internal and external stakeholders. We are always excited to take initiatives and enjoy the process of starting from an idea, then carrying out a complex data analysis, developing the results with the sales team and presenting it with them to our clients.The Data Analyst – Video will initiate, develop and lead analytical projects as part of the wider Analytics team, and help local teams to achieve business targets through actionable insights.What You Will DoDevelop a deep knowledge of Criteo’s technology, products, and position in the marketplaceProject manage and lead the prioritization of business projects and technical projects around our Video productProvide insights to solve operational problems and actively look for opportunities for scaling Video analyses and tools across different business unitsLeverage Python and SQL to answer commercial requestsOwn and maintain reports/tools in Tableau, Python and other data toolsConduct ad-hoc analysis, problem-solving, and troubleshootingWork with cross-functional business units (Account Strategy, Sales, Marketing, Technical Solutions, Central Analytics) to translate data solutions into business solutions.Able to take a recurrent business need and look for ways to address it in a automated and scalable way, both through process optimization and creation of dedicated tools.At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

title: Analyst

company: Food Bank of Central & Eastern North Carolina
html: Job detailsSalary$65,000 - $68,000 a yearFull Job DescriptionThe Food Bank of Central & Eastern North Carolina is an exciting, challenging, and rewarding place to work. Our vision: No one goes hungry, our Mission: Nourish people. Build solutions. Empower communities. We are an equal opportunity employer and are known for our core values of Respect, Integrity, Compassion, Dedication, Teamwork, and Fun!POSITION SUMMARYThe Food Bank of Central & Eastern N.C is looking for a Data Analyst with a passion to serve others in our mission to end hunger in our community. Our network of 900+ food pantries, community kitchens, and other partner agencies helped serve and distribute 34,574,098 pounds of food last year to individuals who are at risk for hunger. As part of the IT team, you will be supporting our efforts to utilize data to more effectively understand and serve those in our service area. We’re looking for a data-savvy professional who can uncover the story behind numbers and tell that story to both technical and non-technical audiences to drive strategy for our organization. If you have a proven track record and passion for analyzing, communicating, modeling, mapping, and visualizing purposeful data, and a collaborative and analytical approach to your work, we highly encourage you to apply.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSDevelop, Implement and Maintain Data Strategy and InfrastructureAdvises Director of IT on best data practices, necessary infrastructure, reporting and business intelligence tools and other technology necessary to support key analytic activities.Develops data governance and analysis protocols.Identifies, sources, and support cleansing new and existing data sources to improve our ability to advocate, fundraises, and explain to donors the needs of those we serve. Lead Data and Statistical Analysis InitiativesWork with management team and department leaders to structure an analytic environment that supports ongoing problem-solving, leveraging expanding data tied to people and ending hunger.Create models to identify trends and track changes across time.Locate and define any new food bank process improvement opportunities and identify and recommend ways to optimize resources by streamlining efforts.Develop analytical presentations to share with key stakeholders, including members, research partners, and donors.Support Data Dissemination Activities and Related ToolsAct as point person for performing rigorous statistical data analysis in-house to support organizational needs.Design and deploy reports, dashboards, and other analytical solutions as necessary.Train staff on use of reports, dashboards and other BI tools.Automates dissemination of data products as practical to improve accuracy and efficiency.Perform other work-related duties as assigned.Act as a Liaison to University PartnersEngage local universities and leverage their resources to expand data analysis capabilities of the Food Bank.Develop a consortium of university partners that come together periodically to share learning and collaborate for the betterment of the Food Bank.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS, QUALIFICATIONS, & EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree with 3 years of experience or equivalent experience in data analytics, statistics, mathematics, economics, social science research, or another related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.A thorough understanding of data analysis, data management, and related BI tools. Demonstrated success in team environments as well as competencies in adaptability, collaboration, and communication. Ability and willingness to learn new technologies.Experience in statistical or other data analysis.Strong and proven understanding of data cleanup challenges, data management strategies, and logical database design.Experience working with databases and manipulation of data.Proficiency in MS Office applications.Proficiency with Tableau/other BI tools such as PowerBI and JetReports.Experience with Azure technologies (AzureSQL, etc.) preferredExperience utilizing consuming data via APIs.The ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience.Committed to organizational mission of ending hunger.PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully.While performing the essential functions of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk, hear, and interact without deliberate impediment (e.g., wearing or listening to headphones, etc.). The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb, balance, lift and/or move up to 10 pounds, and to stoop, crouch, or crawl. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.CONTACTSDaily contact and interaction with Food Bank staff and external parties, including Board members, community members, partner agency representatives, and the general public.WORKING CONDITIONSWhile performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to work in an office setting, which may require extended periods of sitting and the frequent use of a computer.Frequently, the employee will be required to drive an automobile.Other physical demands include the ability to stand and walk during training, carrying materials and hand-outs, flip charts and other audio-visual equipment.The employee will be required to interact with Food Bank personnel in the warehouse(s). In doing so, the employee will occasionally be exposed to moving mechanical parts and vehicles.The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.Occasional weekend and evening work may be necessary.Requires the ability to rapidly adapt and evolve, requiring continual upgrading of skills.EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYERWe are an equal opportunity employer. We do not regard race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, pregnancy, marital status, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation or any protected class characteristic when seeking to hire. This practice, in addition to hiring, applies to our recruiting, training, transfers, promotions, job benefits, pay, dismissal practices, social and recreational activities, and any other term or condition of employment. html: Business AnalystInova is a global leader in personalized health, which leverages precision medicine to predict, prevent and treat disease, enabling individuals to live longer, healthier lives. At Inova, we serve more than two million people each year from throughout the Washington, DC, metro area and beyond. The Business Analyst supports the implementation of improvement plans and new initiatives, as well as the promotion of sound business analysis and project management principles. Identifies, documents, measures, monitors, and recommends improvements to automated and non-automated business processes, in collaboration with stakeholders, in the core areas of case management and care coordination. Develops subject matter expertise on assigned core business areas, including, but not limited to feasibility analysis, technical guidance, thorough understanding of available software, data analysis and reporting, and workflow analysis. Supports initiatives to improve the continuum of patient care, through better alignment of workflows with technology, recommending best course of action, and using objective evidence to evaluate impact. As assigned, leads and project manages departmental activities to achieve Inova's mission and strategic objectives, create strong project momentum, and build stakeholder ownership.RequirementsExperience:Familiarity with business process documentation tools. Experience with data analytics and making data-driven recommendations.Education:Bachelor of Arts or Science or an additional 8 years of relevant experience.Work Site LocationINOVA LOUDOUN HOSPITAL

html: ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:At Polk State, our amazing faculty and staff create an inspiring workplace. This professional position reports to the Chief Information Officer and is an excellent opportunity within the College’s Information Technology department. We offer a collaborative, creative and culturally diverse work environment. If you want to be supported in your efforts to grow professionally and to be recognized for your contributions, then come work for Polk State.SOAR, EAGLES!ABOUT THE POSITION:The Data Analyst position, reporting directly to the CIO in the Information Technology Services department, provides ERP data analysis and report development for various functional areas of the college. This position, will indirectly reporting to the assigned department will analyze user requirements, respond to and resolve user requests/issues, participate in user support and training activities, act in the role of analyst to define/refine processes and support user reporting needs.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES:Partners with key staff members to analyze business processes and needs.Researches new ERP and 3rd party vendor releases/updates to help optimize business processes.Works with functional owners, uses knowledge to create business workflows, identifies and implements solutions.Coordinates technical resources to troubleshoot issues, and supports functional testing cycles, defect tracking, and resolutions.Develops and maintains documentation on ERP and other systems requirements, functional specifications, testing procedures and configurations.Monitors ongoing operation and performs activities to assist with performance tuning and troubleshooting of application issues.Creates reports and provide extracts from databases, analyzes and manipulates data in Excel, Access, data-mining tools or other software, as required, for the task at hand.Attends professional development events or conferences to stay abreast of best practices and compliance changes.Performs other duties as assigned.This position is a level P14. To determine starting salary, Polk State College takes into consideration the pay level minimum, the candidate's qualifications and internal equity factors.Required SkillsWorking knowledge of database interfaces and reporting tools.Experience in development of SQL (or similar program) reports, queries, and scripts.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Superior Excel and Access skillsAbility to work independentlyAbility to manage multiple projectsOrganized with ability to meet critical deadlinesAbility to analyze data, logically create conclusions, and generate technical reports.Required Education:A bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited college or university is required.Required ExperienceA minimum of (2) years of data analyst experience is required.Preferred Experience:Experience with Student Information Systems is preferred.Higher Education experience preferred.We offer an excellent employer-paid benefits package including the following: Medical, Dental, Life, Long-Term Disability, Vacation (except faculty), Holiday and Sick Leave, Retirement (if eligible) and college fee waivers. Other employee-paid, voluntary benefits (vision, short-term disability, etc.) are also available. However, please note that education verification will be completed, for all stated degrees, on or before an interview. Submission of official transcripts for Administrator positions (P17 and above), for all stated degrees, is required as a condition of employment, following receipt of a job offer.Foreign Transcripts: All international degrees must have their coursework evaluated in terms of U.S. "equivalency." (NACES®). title: Data Analyst

html: Job Title: Lead Data Analyst, Customer ServiceWhat this position is about:The Senior Customer Service Analyst specializes in delivering actionable insights that drive business value. Organizing and analyzing data from various sources to understand key pain points and opportunities from the numbers, the Analyst will influence decision making. Within this role, team members use a range of tools and methodologies, including statistics and technical expertise, to generate results which highlight useful insights. Each team member requires high-level communications skills, a strong sense of urgency, and focus on how their analyses will impact the business.What you'll do:Consistently deliver actionable insights that drive data based decision-making on a wide range of initiatives from customer relations, workforce management, and quality assuranceAnalyze data with standard statistical methods, interpret, and summarize resultsEffectively communicate results to teammates and business partnersWork closely with engineering, customer service, and product to create holistic analytic solutionsTurn numbers and data into clear, concise recommendations to help senior leaders make data driven decisionsWhat you'll need:Domain knowledge in customer service analytics such as customer support and CRM.Experience creating insights, providing solutions and exposing possible areas of opportunityCompleted end-to-end data analysis projectsExperience using machine learning techniques in analysis a plus4+ years of applied experience working performing data analysisRequired experience using SQL to create data setsBasic statistical knowledge and usage to drive business decisionsDemonstrated experience visualizing (Tableau, PowerBI etc.)Preferred Bachelor's Degree in relevant field (Economics, Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Computer Science, Finance) or equivalent experience

html: About Ease:Ease is the #1 rated benefits administration and HR software for businesses with 2–250 employees, powered by insurance brokers. 70,000+ employers trust Ease’s innovative SaaS service model to set up and manage benefits, onboard hires, stay compliant and offer their employees one destination for all their human resources information. Headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Las Vegas, and Omaha, Ease was recently ranked number 57 in Forbes 2020 list of the top 500 startup employers in America.Ease videoEase is looking for a Revenue Operations Data Analyst to join the growing Business Operations team. As a RevOps Data Analyst, you will play a key part in building the operational and analytical infrastructure needed to scale the organization. Aside from business process improvements and analytical reporting, the Revenue Operations Data Analyst will also help drive our data strategy, as well as the design and implementation of our Enterprise Data Warehouse.The ideal candidate should be deeply analytical, have a strong business acumen and exceptional communication skills. This is a high-visibility role that will collaborate with Leadership, Engineering, Product, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Support, Operations, and Finance to maximize efficiency for the entire revenue funnel.ResponsibilitiesSupport the company growth through participation in routine planning activities such as forecasting, financial modeling, capacity planning, productivity, performance reports, market segmentation, pipeline coverage, territory carving, quota setting, GTM (go-to-market) strategy etc.Actively engage in initiatives across the revenue organization to identify gaps and build/improve/document business processes, automations or reports to help the business scale.Collaborate directly with executives and stakeholders to deeply understand their data needs.Create reports and dashboards in tools such as Salesforce, Tableau and Gainsight. Define, design, and interpret key performance metrics to deliver insights/recommendations by understanding the drivers behind revenue generation and client retention.Work closely with our Engineering and Business teams to build efficient and sustainable data models (tables, views, ETL workflows, etc…) along with integrations of data collected from new tools into our schema.Work with Engineering to define and document the data architecture, enterprise data assets, data governance and our master data management strategy.Experience / Skills desiredBachelor’s degree in a related technical field.3 - 5 years of experience in a role acting as a liaison between technical/finance and business organizations.Hands-on SQL and Data Modeling/ETL experience.Excel Mastery and prior experience with Tableau or similar BI solutions.Knowledge of key business tools like Salesforce, Marketo, Gainsight, Netsuite (along with their workflows, APIs and data models) strongly preferred.Experience in a high-growth, fast-paced B2B SaaS environment and solid understanding of SaaS metrics/KPIs.A strong self-starter entrepreneurial attitude with the ability to exercise judgment to solve complex and ambiguous problems without direct supervision.Data driven with strong analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills.Ease is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law.

html: Job DescriptionAs a Supply Chain Data Analyst, you will collect and analyze supply chain data to help support Arista’sbusiness decisions. Data analysts will need to look at complex and separate sets of data to help reachconclusions and make recommendations to Arista leadership on improvements to boost performance andreduce costs. Supply chain data analysts also lead process improvement as well as working towardsautomating the collection and analysis of the required data to help support Arista’s business decisions.QualificationsMinimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering or StatisticsMathematical, or in a technical field is preferred.Applicants must possess advanced computer skills, knowledge in Excel, programming languagessuch as Python, and knowledge of structured query language (SQL).Applicants may be required to work under tight schedules, so it is important that they caneffectively manage and prioritize multiple work assignments.Ability to undertake in-depth research, quantify the information, and produce qualitative andquantitative reports. They must also be able to utilize data obtained to develop concisesummaries targeted at decision points.Applicants must also be capable of presenting their findings to Senior Management.Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment, and independently in a fast-paced, andchanging environment is a must.Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

html: At Jack Morton Worldwide, we reimagine what an experience can be. As an industry veteran in experiential marketing, we help clients adapt to the shift from in-person to remote events. It's just one of the ways we push the boundaries of what's possible in every format — virtual, live or hybrid. Our agility to pivot a live event or experience and still convey a sense of community and inclusiveness is in our DNA. In fact, it's what earned us Chief Marketer's Top Marketing Agencies of 2021 award as a best brand engagement and activation agency.The role of Associate Analyst is multi-faceted position. make complex ideas clear, simple and understandableManage secondary data resources, serving as a center of expertise for pulling, aggregating, and reportingInteract with internal marketing teams to understand program objectives, facilitate research planning and the implementation of research at eventsExplain research and metrics findings to internal teams with interpretation of how events and promotions are impacting business objectivesWork with 3rd parties to implement measurement and associated reportingImmerse yourself in the latest trends and developments in Experiential Marketing measurementQualifications:1-2 years' experience in positions involving marketing research or database analyticsStrong analytic skills, knowledge of statistics (significance testing, correlations, sampling, analytic methods) a plusAbility to articulate complex results and concepts to non-analytical staff and clientsKnowledge of consumer trends with ability analyze and integrate diverse sources of information.Education: Bachelor Degree - the specific degree may vary, but a strong background in market research or analytics and the associated skills is requiredRequirements:Client service mind-set, strong attention to detail and commitment to "doing what it takes" to deliver quality work on timeExceptional mathematical and statistical analysis skills preferredStrong collaborator and able to manage others or work independentlyAbility to adapt quickly in a fast paced environmentStrong verbal and written communication skillsProficient with Excel and PowerPointKnowledge of marketing technology is a plusWe make our careers website accessible to any and all users. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.***JOB SCAM ALERT***We have recently become aware that individuals not associated with Jack Morton have fraudulently used our name – and the names of some of our employees – to solicit applications for fake jobs, to conduct fake job interviews and to make fake job offers. Any request to schedule an interview and any bona fide offer of employment will only come from an authorized representative of Jack Morton with an email address "@jackmorton.com". We will never require an applicant to provide credit card or banking information to cover any supposed advance costs.If you have provided personal information in connection with a fake job offer or interview and you are concerned, we suggest that you take appropriate action.Jack Morton takes these activities very seriously and are taking appropriate steps to shut down this fraudulent activity.We urge you to be careful when sharing your personal information and to be aware of scams involving fake job postings and job offers.

html: Job detailsSalary$60,000 - $75,000 a yearFull Job DescriptionAt Deschutes Brewery, we unapologetically make award-winning, damn tasty beer. We are determined to innovate, challenge the status quo, and be thought leaders at every turn. Our company culture bonds us together and creates conditions for success. It is lived daily as a behavioral expression of our collective set of core values: Love It or Dump It, One Team One Dream, Blow Our Customers' Minds, Time for Better Is Now, Celebrate, Crafted for Community and Own It! If you are on our team, it means you are part of creating something extraordinary. You're part of Deschutes.We are currently recruiting for a Business Development Analyst to join our national sales team. The Business Development Analyst will support the entire field sales and national account organizations with business intelligence tools to aid in the achievement of specific sales, distribution, and share goals. This role will work collaboratively with all departments within the company to support sales and gain market share. The Business Development Analyst will interpret sales data and make recommendations to the team. They will prepare and present findings to the executive team, retailers, and distributors. This role will work closely with the Business Development Director and Business Development Specialist.Duties and Responsibilities:Analyze depletion and syndicated sales data to measure Deschutes performance against KPI's, competition, and consumer growth trends - including volume goals, dollar share, distribution, and rate of sale.Collaborate with the sales team to develop broad based and persuasive sales stories and tools to support the sales organization in winning at retail with customers.Assist the national account team with work associated with developing presentations to retailers and distributors designed to help them increase sales and maximize profit.Support entire sales organization with timely analysis of sales, distribution, and pricing trends that support specific market and chain objectives.Develop and maintain a library of turnkey PowerPoint and Excel sales files that can be customized to specific geographies, products, and time periods for use in distributor and retailer presentations.Perform customer insights analysis including industry evaluations, market conditions, retail and consumer trends, and competitor analysis.Perform market and retailer analysis for national accounts to determine opportunities to expand Deschutes distribution and identify new placement opportunities.Business Planning:Support the Business Development team in the development, approval, and implementation of the annual sales volume and budget plan.Proactively report major positive or negative variances to key stakeholders and participate in the development of recommendations to address variances as needed.Pricing:Partner with Finance in price to retailer and price to consumer analysis.Use price to consumer data by market to develop potential annual price to retailer increases and discount programs.Conduct freight on board analysisNational Account Initiative/Deschutes KPI & Company Goal Tracking:Build and update a brand health and performance dashboard that details progress toward quarterly KPIs and annual goals.Develop and present a monthly analysis of national account programs and initiatives.National Account Admin Support with Key Retailers - New item set-up, pricing submissions, updating images, insight slides for syndicated slides.Required Qualifications and Education:4-year college degree or equivalent combination education and experience.Minimum 2 years' experience in CPG and must display product and industry knowledge.Advanced level use of Symphony IRI database. Familiarity with CRM platforms, preferably VIP/KARMAAdvanced level computer skills expert level in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to gather and analyze data from multiple sources and translate it into actionable insights.Able to break problems/information down in order to systematically identify problems/opportunities and make recommendations for their resolution.Able to clearly express ideas, information, or concerns in a straightforward manner and to key stakeholders within the organization.Highly motivated, self-starter, results oriented and ability to adapt to changing priorities with a focus on timelines.Strong analytical skills and ability to synthesize data into insights and compelling selling stories.Strong presentation skills.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working with key National Account Retailers: Kroger, Walmart, Safeway/Albertsons.Additional skills in selling, negotiating, and marketing.Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job, and that candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background. We would encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of our qualifications described. If you are unsure whether you meet the qualifications of this position, or how this would be determined, please feel free to contact HR@deschutesbrewery.com to discuss your application.

title: Data Analyst

html: Overview:The best of modern health care technology, plus the best of small town America!Located in the midst of the beautiful rolling hills and woodlands of Pennsylvania, you don't have to be a native to feel at home here. No matter where your roots, you'll quickly recognize that the staff at DuBois Regional Medical Center (DRMC), like other residents of the community, will make you feel right at home.DuBois Regional Medical Center (DRMC) offers residents of west central Pennsylvania a rare combination of technologically advanced health care in a warm, friendly environment. Widely recognized as one of the leading health centers of its kind in the commonwealth, DRMC is an oasis of clinical and technical excellence, with a focus on patient-centered care. Its rural setting is just far enough from the hustle of the city life to make it peaceful, but close enough to provide easy access to sought-after urban attractions.The Data Analyst supports organizational operations and performance improvement by performing and providing data design, collection, analysis, display and presentation support to Administration, the Medical Staff, hospital departments and Performance Improvement teams. In additional, the Data Analyst provides process analysis and software support as requested and authorized.Responsibilities:Complies with DRMC polices and procedures, with accreditation agency requirements, federal, state, or local law and regulations.Performs and provides data design, collection analysis, display and presentation support to Administration, the Medical Staff, Hospital departments and performance improvement teams.Assists in identifying/clarifying customers’ specific information needs and associated data design and collection/compilation methodologies.Assists in developing, monitoring, and interpreting outcome and process indicators for various Hospital and Medical Staff customer.Design, generate, distribute and assist with the interpretation of routine and ad hoc reports, using appropriate statistical process controls and presentation of formats, in a timely fashion which supports customers’ needs and requirements.Determines if observed differences/variances are statistically significant reports and explains findings to appropriate individuals.Performs process analysis and recommends ways to improve performance.Generates flow charts as required.Manages specific functions associated with the MediQual Atlas clinical database system.Collaborates with the Atlas Abstractor to assure accuracy and timeliness of data input, as well as overall integrity and security of the Atlas database.Assists the P.I. Mangaer as appropriate and requested in responding to the reporting requirements of the Health Care Cost Containment Council (Act 89) and/or contractual/licensing requirements of MediQual, Inc.Utilizes the Atlas database, Atlas Executive, PHC4, and Press-Ganey among other sources, to perform the requirements identified in job essential #1 above.Informs the manager of system status, problems and needs on a regular, on-going basis, recommending action and changes as appropriate.Provides basic software support to those using databases necessary for the advancement of clinical quality.Provides basic user support with respect to spreadsheet, database and word processing.Remains knowledgeable and current as to the functions and responsibilities of the position.Receives reviews and responds to all MediQual + QNet updates program updates and relevant memoranda which are periodically issued and are pertinent to areas of responsibility.Attends and participates in relevant educational opportunities as appropriate to the position and consistent with Hospital policy.Participates in relevant user groups and professional associations as appropriate to the position and approved by the supervisor.Serve as a team resource within a project management environment.As assigned, function as a project team member, resource, and/or facilitator.Perform tasks as assigned and provide data to project leader when functioning as a resource to assigned projects.When serving as project manager, monitor priorities, assignments and schedules for each activity related to the development and/or implementation of projects.When serving as a team member (resource), provide effective feedback to Management or Team Leader and the collaborative management team relating to assigned projects and processes.Performs other duties as assigned.Accepts and performs additional assignments and staff responsibilities as delegated by the Manager of Performance Improvement and the Vice President for Medical Affairs, including but not limited to, those supporting the Hospital’s Performance Improvement, Information Management, Risk Management and Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations compliance efforts.Actively participates in assigned projects by contributing time, effort, knowledge, appropriate leadership, and analytical skills.General duties as dictatedQualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Mathematics or Information Systems, required.Two years experience with the following computer applications, required:- Statistical Analysis - Business Graphics - Spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel preferred)- Flowcharting(Visio preferred) - Word Processing (Microsoft Word preferred)Data (Microsoft Access required)Sound knowledge of and previous experience with, probability and statistics, required.Must demonstrate ability to communicate (written and verbal) in a clear, concise and effective manner.Must utilize strong interpersonal skills, judgment and diplomacy to establish and maintain an effective working relationship with all hospital departments and personnel, the Medical Staff and outside agencies.Training in statistic process control required.Knowledge of continuous quality improvement, total quality management, and/or other performance improvement models and tools preferred.Knowledge and experience with systems analysis and management engineering preferred.Experience and/or training in Health Care Administration preferred.

html: Life at MXWe are driven by our moral imperative to advance mankind - and it all starts with our people, product and purpose. We always carry a deep sense of drive and passion with us. If you thrive in a challenging work environment, surrounded by incredible team members who will help you grow, MX is the right place for you.Come build with us and be part of an award-winning company that’s helping create meaningful and lasting change in the financial industry.Job PurposeMX is well-positioned in the financial technology space as an award-winning provider of financial management and online and mobile banking tools. We are seeking a Product Data Analyst Intern to help us maintain and continuously improve our industry leading data enhancement engine.What you’ll get to do…Perform sampling based audits to calculate and track metrics around our Data Cleansing and Enhancement effortsAssist in analyzing data sets from client prospects to show the power of our PlatformPerform manual validation of cleansing and categorization within our Data Enhancement engineYou’ll do it using your…Students pursuing a BS/MS in Statistics, Dat Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or Computer ScienceGraduation date Fall 2021 or laterA lifelong love of learningA strong sense of curiosityA serious passion for working with data & comfort with its inherent messinessStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsProficiency with business productivity tools such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google AppsYou’ll thrive by…Driven — You have the ambition and intelligence to make great things even better.Passionate — You obsess about perfection and love your data.Entrepreneurial — You like to wear many hats and thrive on the urgency that drives a start-up.Technological — You are analytical and like to solve problems with technology.Execution Focused — You know what needs to be done, but more importantly, you make it happen.Problem Solver – You see the problems and focus on finding the solution.Self-Guided – You don’t need, and probably despise, micro-management.You’ll love it because…You will have the opportunity to work in a successful, fast-moving, mission-driven companyThis is an incredibly impactful role in the organizationYou will have autonomy and growth opportunitiesYou will collaborate with other creative and enthusiastic team membersYou will be rewarded and recognized for your high-caliber work

html: THIS IS NOT A TECHNICAL ROLEWho we areFor 20+ years, our mission has been to increase the presence and accessibility of natural and organic products to encourage healthier and more vibrant living. By leveraging SPINS' industry-leading proprietary data and analytics, our technology enables deeper, more engaged relationships between Retailers, Brands and Consumers through our platform, web, and mobile products. At the core of our work lies a passion to create a culture of sustainable health & wellness.Our TeamThe Attribute Data Analyst Team contributes to the development of attributes, enabling SPINS customers to meet business objectives. SPINS is a wellness-focused data technology company and is committed to providing dynamic data and actionable insights to the retail and CPG industry to contribute to a healthier and more vibrant community. This team simplifies product data into relevant characteristics and attributes that power SPINS Product Intelligence solutions and products.What you will doThe Attribute Data Analyst will use a variety of product information from diverse sources in order to synthesize data. This person will have expertise in market trends and have strong data-driven analytical skills. The Attribute Data Analyst will develop and maintain data structure and product databases, generating data deliverables under quality procedures, industry and regulatory standards. This role is an excellent entry point for exposure to the world of big data for health and wellness CPG.The successful candidate will interact with a variety of cross-functional teams including customer support, data generation, product fact teams and others. This person should be driven, inquisitive, and agile with a strong business sense while being data-driven, technology curious, and have a passion for health and wellness.What you bringBachelor's degree, preferably in business or a science-related fieldAbility to work independently as well as part of a cross-functional teamSelf-motivated; able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment under pressure, adhering to deadlinesAdept at learning new technologies and business functions, working proactively to problem solve and take initiativeFamiliarity with excel, file editor, relational databases, and/or other data management toolsAbility to analyze raw volumes of data to perform trend analysis or other insightsDesire to understand and interpret simple coding language, database infrastructure, and data structureQualifications Desired:Minimum 1-2 years' experience in related fieldExposure to retail or consumer packaged goods dataExperience in data management or data operationsExperience/familiarity in food, dietary supplements, and/or personal care product labeling/regulatory knowledgeFamiliarity with power BI and business intelligence data applicationsEssential Functions and Responsibilities:Analyze and synthesize UPC product information in order to develop attribute characteristics from a variety of product and data sources, including but not limited to third party data, images, SPINS business intelligence tools, and Product Intelligence databasesDevelop and maintain attribute classifications based on provided framework and direction, maintaining SPINS Product Intelligence databases with up-to-date product contentAssist and participate in development and implementation of SOPs for attribute, UPC, and other Product Intelligence data definitions and processes.Use simple coding language, data and insights to recommend and implement improvements to attribute development processes.Build data taxonomies and data structure rules to develop new attributes according to industry, regulatory and/or client requirements, under the guidance of managers and product management.Identify key themes and/or trends by monitoring and researching trends and industry matters to gain understanding of industry and integrate findings into attribute recommendations.Foster and maintain relationships with cross-functional teams to manage and execute projects that improve SPINS UPC attribute offering, ensuring Product Intelligence needs are represented and deadlines are observedCollaborate with internal and external clients to resolve customer data issuesOccasionally support the Marketing, Commercial, and Product Intelligence teams through training and subject matter expertise of the Product Intelligence portfolio or offering additional support.Occasionally participate in communications with audiences directly through articles, webinars, and customer engagementsExplore, participate in and support ad hoc data and other business initiatives as needed, performing product and data analysis outside of standard frameworkGenerate and communicate status on assigned tasks and projectsHandle competing priorities and heavy project workloadsWhy SPINS?When we began working from home in 2020, we were committed to keeping the healthy and active SPINS culture for our employees. Keeping the culture is high priority to us as we have continued to hire and onboard new employees even while we worked remotely. We listen to employee feedback as we plan when and how we will return to the office in the future. While we can't have some of our favorite in-office perks (plenty of snacks, onsite gym, and bike storage), we've continued to find ways to stay true to SPINS:Virtual yoga, HIIT, and Kinstretch classes each weekEach employee is allotted 8 hours to use to volunteer with an organization of their choice.Stay connected with other SPINS employees for a weekly PELOTON ride togetherThe SPINS WayDirect – We communicate with clarity, honesty and respect in all situations and embrace opportunities to provide solution-oriented feedback.Determined – We are committed to overcoming all obstacles to achieve results. We adapt to change, seek opportunities to learn and rapidly translate that learning into action.Passionate – We go above and beyond to help our partners achieve their goals. We challenge assumptions and are comfortable forging new paths.Collaborative – We leave our egos at the door, believing that working together we will produce an outcome that's greater than each individual contribution.

html: Job Title - Data AnalystLocation: North Sioux City, SDJob Description: We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.Duties and responsibilities:Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.Data collection, interpretation, and reporting for the consideration of business decisions. This work encompasses several duties and responsibilities including:Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and provide ongoing reportsWork with management to prioritize business and information needsLocate and define process improvement opportunitiesEstablish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisionsUse graphs, infographics, and other methods to visualize dataCreate presentations and reports based on recommendations and findingsSkills and qualifications:A successful candidate will have various skills and qualifications that help them solve problems using large amounts of data.Analytical problem-solving and troubleshooting skillsKnowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming techniquesUnderstanding of data warehousing and ETL techniquesCoding skills in languages such as SQL, SOQL, Python and/or RReporting and data visualization skills using software like Qlik SenseProficiency in Microsoft ExcelExcellent attention to detailStrong written/verbal communication skillsAbility to set and meet deadlines and work in high-pressure situationsEducation and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related fieldThree years’ experience working with large, complex data setsThe ability to provide a portfolio of data projects to demonstrate skillsExperience as a Salesforce.com administrator is preferredSterling Computers is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, national origin or any other characteristics protected under federal, state or applicable local law.
