html: CityGreen BayLocationWisconsinCompany descriptionStarted in 1933, Green Bay Packaging Inc. (GBP) is a privately family-owned , vertically integrated and diversified manufacturing company consisting of corrugated container converting plants, folding carton operations, recycled and virgin linerboard mills, pressure-sensitive label rollstock, specialty converting operations, timberlands, and a sawmill facility. Headquartered in Green Bay, Wisconsin, Green Bay Packaging Inc. employs more than 4,000 team members and operates over 30 facilities in 14 states each with a dedication to innovative development of its products and forestry resources, with a focus on safety, quality, sustainability, and continuous improvement. For more information about Green Bay Packaging Inc., visit www.gbp.com.Division descriptionThe Green Bay Packaging Data Analyst position is an onsite Information Technology position that is responsible for all elements involved with the design, development, testing, implementation, and maintenance of data reporting systems and tools. The Data Analyst is charged with assisting in architecting the data warehouse and enterprise reporting structures. They take multiple diverse data sources and combine them to fulfill the company standard and ad-hoc reporting requirements. Additionally, the Data Analyst position provides design specifications for EDI mapping for purchase orders, order confirmations, advanced ship notices and invoices for various GBP customers and vendors.Job descriptionDuties and Responsibilities:Develop and maintain interface specifications for EDI trading partnerships with GBP customers.The position will be responsible for support and troubleshooting of existing EDI Trading Partner setups.Develop and maintain a sustainable and extensible data warehouse reporting environment.Interface directly with key business representatives to gather and define reporting needs.Design and develop data security control structure.Develop and run a variety of enterprise level ad-hoc and standard reports.Determine and implement report delivery mechanisms.Troubleshoot and resolve data problems.Create and maintain both end-user and IT department documentation.Train others in the use of pre-defined reports and ad-hoc reporting.QualificationsExperience Required:Qualified candidates will have 4+ years of IT industry experience with a minimum of 2 years of related experience designing and developing data warehouse solutions, SQL database design and Microsoft SQL server. Experience with the Microsoft BI Platform is preferred. Strong technical background in database administration and development is a must.Education Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.Travel Required:Minimal.Skills Required:Strong understanding of database structures, design, and reporting techniques required. Fluent in the creation of complex reports, scripts, and stored procedures.Analytical ability to gather and interpret requirements and then utilize those requirements to develop, recommend and implement reporting solutions.Must display good verbal and written communication skills. Have the ability to work directly with business users and software vendors on problems and projects.Ability to communicate complex technical issues clearly and effectively to any audience.Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.Ability to organize work respond to changing priorities and multitaskJob TypeOfficeSalary/benefitsIn addition to a competitive wage, the selected candidate will enjoy an excellent benefit package including medical, dental, prescription drug, STD, LTD, and company matching 401(k).Green Bay Packaging Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

Millions of people and organizations count on Sedgwick each year to take care of their needs when they face a major life event or something unexpected happens. Whether they have a workplace injury, suffer property or financial loss or damage from a natural or manmade disaster, are involved in an auto or other type of accident, or need time away from work for the birth of a child or another medical situation, we are here to provide compassionate care and expert guidance. An employee hired into this role will be responsible for providing space, telephone, printing, networking and/or internet capabilities at the telecommute location and agree to the terms of the University of Utah campus and Health Academics COVID-19 Telecommuting Agreement.ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities:Maintains tracking dashboards for determined KPIs in Google Data Studio.Assists in client management via data presentations.Presents data or represents manager at meetings when necessary.Assists internal community of web support persons with analytics reports and comprehension as necessary.Conducts competitor analyses as necessary.Collaborates with web developers on technical SEO aspects.Monitors site speed and other technical SEO functions to assess and improve website capabilities if needed.Monitors branded keywords and phrases.Supports and collaborates with content specialists in relation to content creation and maintenance.Recognizes anomalies and patterns in data, raise questions and annotate dataMeasure and analyze a/b test, audience segments to support personalization and conversion efforts.This job description is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.Work Environment and Level of Frequency typically requiredNearly Continuously: Office environment.Physical Requirements and Level of Frequency that may be requiredNearly Continuously: Sitting, hearing, listening, talking.Often: Repetitive hand motion (such as typing), walking.Seldom: Bending, reaching overhead.Minimum QualificationsRequires a bachelor’s degree in related area (2 years related work experience may be substituted for 1 year of education). Two to four years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description.PreferencesPreferred Skills/Experience:3–4 years data/analytics experienceWorking knowledge Google Tag ManagerWorking knowledge Google Data Studio or other reporting dashboardsWorking knowledge htmlHigh level MS Excel proficiencyPresentation and reporting skillsQuantitative skills and ability to manipulate large sets of dataFollow-through on assigned tasksAbility to construct reports in dashboard format or via PPWorking knowledge of SEO and SEMExperience in These Tools:Google analyticsGoogle data studioGoogle tag managerGoogle search consoleMS Office (Excel, teams, etc.)CrawlersHelpful, but Not Required:Google Local SearchTechnical SEO experienceExperience in DrupalExperience in personalization or audience segmentationExperience with tools like Screaming Frog, SEM Rush, Moz, ahrefs, and othersType Benefited Staff Special Instructions Summary

Document data transformations.Identify and document business requirementsPerform and document data profilingRequired Qualifications:Bachelor's with 2 - 5 years (or commensurate experience)3+ years of Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing experienceSDLC experienceStrong SQL skillsStrong ability to perform data analysis and data profilingProven experience developing documentation such as: requirements, testing, user casesExcellent verbal and written communications skillsThe candidate should be able to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level.The candidate should be able to adjust his/her message to different audiences: developers, end users, PMs, etc.Ability to work with ETL developers, data modelers and Business Intelligence developers to solve issues/defects and develop business solutions.Flexibility in commuting to Alexandria, VA (remote work during pandemic)Bachelor's Degree - preferably in computer science, information systems or related fieldDesired Qualifications:Experience with reporting/data visualization tools, such as OBIEE, Tableau, etc.Experience with data analysis in the cloud (AWS, Azure, etc)Federal consulting experienceAgile methodology experienceJIRA/Confluence experienceSalient CRGT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. html: Our mission is to Create Delightful Human Environments.In the great tradition of challenging the way we think about everyday essentials, the team at View has revitalized something that hasn't changed for centuries – the simple window – and in doing so, is transforming the largest industry in the world, real estate.View is a technology company creating smart and connected buildings to improve people’s health and wellness, while simultaneously reducing energy consumption to mitigate the effects of climate change. View is the market leader in smart windows that let in natural light and views and enhance mental and physical well-being by reducing headaches, eyestrain, and drowsiness. Every View installation includes a 'smart building platform' that consists of power, network, and communication infrastructure. For more information, please visit view.comIf you have ever dreamed of changing the world to make it a better place - join us!OUR CULTURE AND VALUESWe are committed to our culture. We actively use our culture in how we conduct business.Safety FirstCustomer CentricLearning OrientedDrive for ExcellenceCommunicate DirectlySucceed as a TeamPOSITION SUMMARYThe successful candidate will work with the Reliability and Quality teams to collect and analyze field performance and internal test data, flexibly adjusting between regularly scheduled and impromptu analysis requests per a well-defined priority order, and thus providing these teams with the necessary insight to drive improvements in product performance. Active, real time review of data for potential anomalies or unexpected correlations and immediate escalation of these issues is critical for this position. The candidate may be infrequently asked to assist with the durability testing and characterization of View product.ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIESCompilation, review, and processing of data from internal development and testingComplication, review, and processing of field performanceDocumentation and communication of resultsRecommend process modification for improved efficiency or accuracyFlexibility to perform other processes in R&D as neededDESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEExcellent attention to detail-specifically as it pertains to reporting, troubleshooting and analytical skillsAbility to work under pressure and tight deadlinesStrong problem-solving skillsBasic understanding of statistical analysis of data (average, standard deviation, trend plotting)Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and OutlookAbility to shift focus among multiple priorities quicklyEffective communication, both verbally and in writingAbility to lift up to 40 lbs.Ability to strictly follow safety instructions and use proper PPE following training and instructionEDUCATIONAssociates degree or preferably Bachelor’s degree in physical sciences or engineering, or equivalent work experience requiredView, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer

html: Job detailsJob TypeCommissionFull Job DescriptionJob Summary Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.Our team is looking for a hands-on analyst who can leverage Comcast Business’s abundant data assets to deliver user-friendly outputs that drive key financial decision-making for its users. This person will import, clean, transform, and manipulate data that directly relates to the transactional level detail of the Company’s products and services. This self-starter will integrate knowledge of the business to serve as a key contributor in a complex and crucial financial environment. A basic understanding of financial concepts and their function in the operations of a business is preferred.Job DescriptionCore ResponsibilitiesCreates and edits sophisticated SQL language to query large data platforms to acquire data vital for analysisJoins together large, disparate data sets to uncover impactful insights.Supports analytics projects to identify and quantify opportunities to drive the businessCreates and automates foundational and supporting dashboards that align with business needsApplies learned knowledge of the Comcast Business product portfolio to make outputs user-friendly to non-financial stakeholdersIdentifies, tracks and analyzes trends in a variety of data sources to develop improvements for processes, forecasting and planningActs as technical resource for team membersFollows best practices in business intelligence data analysis, maintenance, and data qualityEffectively manage competing priorities through planned and ad-hoc requestsPromotes a culture of excellence, data driven discussions, healthy skepticism, intellectual curiosity, knowledge sharing, and teamwork, while maintaining an environment that is upbeat and funDesired Skills and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in a technical field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or StatisticsHeavy finance experience not required, however, minimal experience is preferred.4+ years of experience with business intelligence, analytics and data warehouse technologies (e.g. Power BI/Tableau, SQL or Cloud data warehouse platforms)Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own disciplineStrong problem solving and critical thinking skillsEmployees at all levels are expected to:Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.Drive results and growth.Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.EducationBachelor's DegreeRelevant Work Experience5-7 YearsBase pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.
title: Sr Data Analyst

html: WHO IS CALLREVUCallRevu helps thousands of automotive dealers in the U.S. cultivate their customer experience on the phone. CallRevu gives dealers valuable insights into their caller's journey by tracking, monitoring, listening to, summarizing, alerting, and reporting on dealership phone calls to monitor call performance. With our robust data and reporting, we are able to coach and enhance the caller's experience to help dealers increase market share, customer retention, and profitability in all phases of dealership operations. Created and managed by a team of automotive and technology professionals, CallRevu partners with some of the best known and highest performing dealerships across the U.S. to not only report issues and outcomes, but fix them.POSITION SUMMARYIn this Remote working opportunity, the Data Analyst elicits, analyzes, validates, documents, and manages the real needs of project stakeholders, including customers and end users, to serve as the conduit between the customer community/experience and the technical solution product and development teams. The Data Analyst collaborates with the development, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand their business needs and processes to translate findings to software requirements using both Agile and traditional software development and methodologies. This role is a crucial component in managing and expanding efforts to expand our data-driven processes across CallRevu to set the direction for all business intelligence (BI) efforts moving forward.A Typical Week May Look Like:Data Analytics and Business Intelligence (BI)Leads requirements elicitation, prioritization, and documentation from stakeholders using various methods, such as user stories, interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, story boards, wire frames, brainstorming sessions, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, and scenarios. This includes creating data sets to extract and synthesize data to interpret quantitative and qualitative analyses.Ensures data being analyzed is aligned with key business indicators and metrics that influence the financial health and strategic vision of CallRevu.Creates and reports/queries for optimization using tools such as SQL, Tableau, SSRS, and PowerBI to provide necessary insights.Leads the development of data insight that will help drive strategic and tactical business opportunities and is the champion for data-driven decision making.Partners with the engineering, development, marketing, and product teams to determine what data should be analyzed to assist the sales team in developing a “story” for our customers.Partners with stakeholders to solve any business problems and, as needed, assists in designing solutions.Analyzes information to identify trends, patterns, gaps, and insights using descriptive analytics.Proactively develops reporting and conducts drill-down analysis to identify specific variances in cost and end-user utilization.Communication and Project ManagementMaintains a deep awareness of how the business operations work to help stakeholders identify problems early to generate creative solutions and ideas for prompt resolution.Serves as a liaison to communicate requirements to the development and product teams to facilitate detailed requirement gathering with stakeholders during development lifecycle.Partners with product owners/managers to make necessary decisions around product implementation and priorities. Ensures all necessary parties are informed of project priorities and schedules.Assists project management team with release planning to ensure stakeholders vision, processes, and priorities are represented.Facilitates requirement traceability, categorization, and management and assists in planning and scoping inter-related projects for various initiatives.Serves as the liaison between product owners to understand the structure, policies, data, and operations of the organization. Validates with stakeholders to ensure requirements are written clearly and with enough detail to be implementable by development and testable by quality assurance.Builds, confirms, and prioritizes project plans and deliverables with department leadership and the executive leadership team (ELT).Attends customer meetings as needed and identified by the sales team to assist in showing customers the value of CallRevu's products and solutions.Facilitates and assists with customer training as appropriate to ensure products are being fully utilized.Communicates analytic concepts and findings to all levels within CallRevu, including developing communication that summarizes conclusions, presents actionable opportunities, and proposes strategic and operational options.Leads reviews of business processes with the appropriate departments present to develop optimization strategies and build necessary business cases for making changes to existing practices, programs, and/or procedures.LeadershipEstablishes BI and analytics as a practice and develops best practice guide and template to develop and set a solution design standard.Provides technology insights and process consulting services to internal and external CallRevu customers to raise awareness and assist in telling the product story and value add.Serves as a coach and mentor to the data analytics team to ensure quality results are achieved across CallRevu, while scaling our analytics functionality.Maintains up-to-date knowledge on the latest processes, trends, and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.Ensures alignment to CallRevu's Mission, Vision, and Values to meet organizational goals.Collaborates with peers and colleagues in other departments to improve CallRevu's operations.Is This You:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent combination of work experience and education.3 to 5 years' experience in business analytics, preferably in the technology or automotive industry.Minimum 3 years' experience in writing complex SQL queries.Experience in performing SQL queries optimizations across large datasets.Working knowledge and experience using visualization tools such as Tableau, SSRS, and PowerBI.Working knowledge of VBA.Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (advanced Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).Experience in NoSQL/Big data environments is a plus.Strong technical skills, including data modeling, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques. Experience using Python a plus.Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Demonstrated ability to think strategically and innovatively, while supporting company-wide initiatives and goals.Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and disseminate/report on significant amounts of information via reports and dashboards with attention to detail and accuracy.Exceptional data technology and analytics knowledge and experience in data warehouse methodologies and BI practices, including, but not limited to, data management, data integration, and analytics system architecture.Experience documenting and managing requirements using multiple methodologies (i.e. Agile, Waterfall, etc.) and experience managing software implementations in an enterprise level environment and GAP analysis using process flows or other modeling tools/languages.Energetic, go-getter with strong abilities to build relationships, follow up on requests, manage projects, and complete tasks according to prioritization.Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously, while maintaining a forward-thinking mindset to understand the upcoming needs of the sales, product, and development teams.Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.Ability to multi-task and respond to changing needs as they present in a fast-paced environment.Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and interpersonal.Ability to align to CallRevu's Mission, Vision, Values, and goals to support the sale initiatives and organizational needs.MissionCallRevu drives actionable insights for dealerships to improve their digital and voice communications for greater conversion of leads to appointments.VisionTo be an industry leader in conversational intelligence for the dealer industry.ValuesCallRevu is committed to:BEING BOLD, unafraid, and courageous in everything we do.INNOVATION - bringing new, industry-leading, ideas to market.GROWTH in new relationships, new capabilities, and new markets.PARTNERSHIP that is collegial, collaborative, and always focused on the win-win.INTEGRITY shown by doing the right thing, being accountable (being a 80 Leader) and delivering as promised (being a 20 Contributor).Apply now to join us!CallRevu, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.
title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)

html: Customer Experience (CX) Senior Data SpecialistGoby, the leader in ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) solutions for investment management companies in Real Estate and Private Equity, is seeking motivated and goal-oriented critical thinkers to join our Customer Experience team. The team balances top-notch, value creating interactions with executives and day-to-day operators at Goby customers with opportunities to drive the future of ESG through internal problem-solving efforts across multiple functions.The Customer Experience Senior Data Specialist Role:The Senior Data Specialist is a critical enabler of customer value. The Senior Data Specialist will be responsible for the collecting, interpreting and analyzing data to solve Customer needs by leveraging streamlined processes, structured problem-solving techniques and data management principles. The Senior Data Specialist will work closely with Customer Success Managers and Solution Architects to enable customer success and ensure that all foundational enablement elements for customer accounts are effective.Key Responsibilities Include:Working closely with customers to resolve data issuesManaging customer onboarding and ongoing maintenancePresenting analysis of data to internal and external stakeholdersDevelop effective processes and guidelines that enable process improvementsA CX Senior Data Specialist at Goby is part of the impactful Customer Experience team, which is accountable for the value we create for our customers. As such, the three core responsibilities of the role align with those of the Customer Experience team:Customer Value Creation: When Goby begins our relationship with new customers, the Customer Experience team will be actively involved in bringing them on to Goby’s platform by working directly with senior executives and frontline roles at our customers.Customer Management: Once customers are established on Goby’s platform, the Customer Experience team will continue to own the relationship to ensure that customers are able to see increasing value from the relationship with Goby and this requires strong business acumen, problem solving skills, and relationship building ability.Internal Enablement: In addition to working directly with customers, the Customer Experience team will have the opportunity to work with internal leaders and teams to continuously improve our products and offerings to drive growth. We are looking for problem solvers with experience as individual contributors and as people developers.Customer Experience roles are measured on the following competencies:Leadership: Demonstrate initiative and an ownership mindset, where individuals identify and own to completion value creating opportunities for Goby customers, our internal operations and product, and our people.Problem Solving: Leverage structured thinking and focus on root causes to plan and solve problems once and for all.Customer Centricity: Embrace the idea that value creation enables customers to partner with Goby perpetually and use every available opportunity to create value.Effective Communication: Exhibit the ability to set and manage customers’ and internal stakeholders’ expectations, along with the ability to communicate comprehensively and cohesively in written and verbal forms.Operational Discipline: Collaborate effectively with the rest of the team and meet customer needs through a strong grasp about processes and technology, and objective use of data.What this role offers you:Work in a highly visible role where your efforts have a real business impact on our customers and our internal operations.Grow your career with Goby as we continue to grow as a leader in the ESG space.The ideal candidate will have the following professional experiences and inclinations:Bachelor's degree in engineering, sciences, or business.2-4 years of relevant post-bachelor’s experience in a project environment serving customers and / or internal stakeholders. E.g. consulting (external or internal) or similar corporate roles with a mix of day-to-day operations and time-bound project experiences are desirable.Demonstrable interest / experience in sustainability and ESG initiatives is preferredDemonstrable experience working across functions and seniority levels.Understanding of process methodologies and effective use of data, especially if trained in methodologies such as Six Sigma, or similar analytical frameworks.Strong experience with technology platforms such as ERPs, CRMs, or related niche technologies and an understanding of SaaS business model.Ability to learn and assess customer needs and a variety of business operating models.Interest in career growth through continuously developing breadth and depth of skills.Interview Process:Step 1: Send us your resume along with a short summary of why you are interested in this role.Step 2: Human Resources screening for alignment and fit for the role.Step 3: Professional experience and skills deep dive.Step 4: Panel interview with Goby leaders and PeersStep 5: Final decisionBenefits of working at Goby:Dynamic, entrepreneurial company backed by Venture CapitalHealth care, 401(k), and employee stock option benefitsOffice space in a classic downtown Chicago building.Goby is a fast-growth company and we are looking for an eager mind who wants to grow with us. Flexibility, curiosity, an entrepreneurial mindset, and strong work ethic are essential for this role. Goby has embraced a remote-working culture and is accepting top candidate across the US. This position is not eligible for H1B or other work visa sponsorships.
title: Data Analyst

html: About Teleflex IncorporatedTeleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people’s lives. We apply purpose driven innovation – a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs – to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.Global Functions – The Corporate division is the central operating unit of the company; setting strategy and policy and providing business development, finance, human resources, information technology, investor relations and legal support to the businesses. The global Company headquarters is located just outside of Philadelphia in Wayne, PA. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers an array of medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients’ lives.Position SummaryThe Logistics Specialist & Data Analyst will report to the Program Manager & Senior Data Analyst to provide complex analytics in support of day-to-day reporting and strategic initiatives. This position will be responsible for maintaining and updating key reports to evaluate our logistics efficiency across North and Latin America. The Logistics Specialist and Data Analyst will also focus on strategic initiatives to continuously improve our offerings to internal and external stakeholdersPrincipal ResponsibilitiesSupport the Program Manager & Snr Data Analyst in the feasibility studies, planning and execution of continuous improvement initiatives to drive best in class value and service for Teleflex and our customers.Model, maintain and run reports to present spend visibility and Transportation key performance indicators to senior management.Monitor and provide analysis with commentary on Transportation spend trends per mode, carrier, lane, and by CBM and weight.Utilize data to uncover potential future cost and service improvement projects.Develop and publish KPIs on the performance of Transport & Logistics in North & Latin America.Resolve ad-hoc operational problems and data requests.Analyze data, draw sound conclusions and recommend effective courses of action for NALA operations.Liaise with Regional Transport Managers to assist in carrier performance analysis and QBRs.Extract data, analyze and make recommendations based on impact analysis.Support formulation and development of long-term strategic plans by performing analytical tasks such as viability assessments and what-if analysis.Provide project management and analytics support on ongoing L&D initiatives.Support consolidation and automate reporting, auditing and payment processing into one control tower.Drive projects to completion and achieve cost savings target.Create Transportation Innovation Committee to propose new ideas on how to improve Teleflex logistics network and stay on top of Transportation innovation.Develop and support deployment of new technology systems and systems upgrades.Education / Experience RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management with minor in AnalyticsBachelor’s Degree in Analytics with minor in Logistics, Supply Chain ManagementEquivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.At least two years of experience or six months of internship experience (if internship, must present portfolio)Experience in medical device and transportation industries is highly preferredSpecialized Skills / Other RequirementsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProficient using Tableau Desktop or Tableau Server, R and ExcelExperience with MIS in Transportation and Logistics (EDI, file transfers, BOL, etc.)Experience in Project Management principles, concepts, practices, standards, and related tool as applicableStrong analytical, statistical, and problem-solving skills requiredExperience with SAP or ERP preferredExperience with Transportation Management System preferredTeleflex, Inc. is an affirmative action & equal opportunity employer. D/V/M/F. Applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. If you require accommodation to apply for a position, please contact us at: 262-439-1894.

html: Our Company: PharmaCord is a leading provider in pharmaceutical patient support services. Our services are sponsored by our pharmaceutical company clients. Together, we are committed to compassionately providing patients with support services during their journey on therapy.We deliver our services through our talented team of benefit specialists, nurses, pharmacists, case managers, pharmacy techs, program managers, and other incredibly talented team members who are supported by world-class proprietary technology systems developed in house by our team of engineers, system architects, coding professionals and data scientists.We are PharmaCord, a purpose-driven organization on a rapid growth journey.Our Team: Our team is highly motivated and passionate about providing the highest quality customer support to our patients. We look for individuals interested in growing with our company and working in an exciting, open and collegial work environment. We seek problem solvers who are compassionate, have high integrity and demonstrate grit. Our colleagues are enthusiastic team members who love what they do and are passionate about making a difference through their work. We take initiative, exhibit pride in our accomplishments, and are trusted to work independently while collaborating to share ideas, support, and resources.The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating reports and providing insights to the company and client leadership teams as well as maintaining and growing our analytics environment. They will also be responsible for implementing and maintaining data structured data exchanges, data visualizations in Microsoft Power BI, email marketing and marketing automation campaigns.This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The ideal candidate has proven work experience in taking a vaguely stated business question or need and unpacking it into specific requirements, data sources, reports, and/or other criteria. They will be responsible for data analysis, profiling of incoming client data, driving our reporting and email marketing efforts, and providing key metrics in support of multiple development and operations teams. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively with minimal oversight.Responsibilities:The Data Analyst responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:Develop reports, queries, data exchanges and data analyses by leveraging or enhancing existing data infrastructure, while taking various technical constraints, usability, maintainability, and performance into accountAnalyze large volumes of complex data that requires consideration of multiple factors to interpret the informationImplement data structure and mapping designs using SQL Server, data marts, queries, and stored procedures; and with building out data visualizations in Microsoft Power BIBuild and maintain predictive modeling/forecasts, machine learning algorithms and data workflow automationsCollaborate with external vendors to troubleshoot integrations that feed databases and Power BI datasetsEnsure proper gateways, user security, permissions, authentication and authorization across the Power BI environmentTrain and educate end-users on the usage and capabilities of Power BIProvide operational support for Power BI, data exchanges and integrations; ensure data exchange jobs complete successfully; monitor alerts and resolve issues that ariseBe good at using Excel and manipulating data using formulas and pivot tablesBe responsible for managing email marketing campaigns on behalf of clients and tracking and reporting email campaign metrics (bounces, opens, forwards, etc.)Work with clients to handle ad hoc requests for information about their marketing campaigns and to send out information in appropriate formatsAll other duties as assignedQualifications:Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 2 years of professional work experience in a mid-sized or large corporate Information Technology environment dealing with reporting and data analysis. Strong technical knowledge of SQL programming, database structures, ETL programming, Python, R, Excel and building data visualizations in Microsoft Power BI. Able to create accurate data structures and appealing visualizations in a clean, intuitive, and insightful format. Exceptional relationship management skills and the ability to build and grow connections with people. html: Phreesia is looking for a Senior Sales Operations Data Analyst to provide Phreesia leadership with critical analysis and insights for decisions related to Phreesia's rapidly growing sales organization. In this role you will be instrumental in guiding the direction of Phreesia's sales strategy and operations through robust, data-driven insights and analytics. This individual will be responsible for sales forecasting, detailed budgeting and operations planning, data design & architecture, and other business analyses. The Sales Data Analyst role will sit in the Sales & Marketing Operations team and work closely with Sales, Sales Development, Market Development, Finance and Marketing.What You'll Do:Perform quantitative analysis of sales and pipeline dataBuild and manage financial models for bookings and revenue forecastingDevelop detailed operating budgets for the sales & marketing organizationDesign and maintain sales metric reportingGuide sales data architecture for optimal reporting and analyticsDevelop and test hypotheses related to sales performance and metricsInterpret underlying trends and translate takeaways from analyses into business recommendationsWhat You'll Bring:4+ years of experience in investment banking, private equity, FP&A or other related financial fieldsStrong analytical and quantitative skillsExpert Excel skills required; familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM is a plus but not requiredProficiency in data analytics / working with large data setsExcellent communication skills with the ability to work effectively at all levels within the organizationOrganized, disciplined, and process-orientedMotivated self-starterHigh level of personal and professional integrityBachelor's degree or higherWho We Are:At Phreesia, we're committed to helping healthcare organizations succeed in a fast-changing landscape—and we need smart, passionate people to help us do it. Our innovative SaaS platform offers our clients a suite of applications to manage the intake process, giving them the tools to engage patients, improve efficiency, optimize staffing and enhance clinical care. Our solutions are in all 50 states, and we check in 70 million patients a year!Basically, what you are doing here matters and hard work does not go unnoticed. Not only does Phreesia care about our clients we also care about our employees. We are proud to say that we have grown 40% each year and consistently continue to do so. If you crave working with driven and engaged colleagues, a structured sales process, consistent recognition, defined career path, and enjoy working in revamped new areas, this may be the right opportunity for you.Benefits and Perks:Variety of health plan options, dental/ vision coverage, and short/long-term and life insurance plans401(k) savings planFlexible working hoursUnlimited vacationMobile phone stipends and internet reimbursementFitness reimbursement100% paid maternity leave to our U.S. employees, as well as a generous maternity benefit to our employees in Canada.Tuition and certification reimbursement, as well as other professional development opportunitiesWe strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

html: Who we are:Argo AI is in the business of building self-driving technology you can trust. With experienced leaders in the field and collaborative partnerships with some of the world's largest automakers, we're building self-driving technology that is engineered to scale globally and transform mobility for millions.Talented individuals join our team because they share our purpose to make it safe, easy, and enjoyable for everyone to get around cities. We aspire to impact key industries that move people and goods, from ride hailing to deliveries.Meet the team:We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all. Vehicle Operations' essential function at Argo is to safely execute the test and road operations initiatives set forth by our engineering team. Vehicle Operations consists of a team of experts who understand Argo's underlying vehicle technology and programs. The team then uses that information to effectively manage efforts to meet our mileage and performance goals. These programs will provide detailed feedback to our engineering team on how our vehicles are performing.The Argo Vehicle Operations team is seeking someone to join our team as a Data Analyst. At the heart of it, this role will be responsible for developing and managing information to support decision making. You will also create, manage and improve existing reporting systems and perform complex analyses. Our once-small team has since grown into an over 1,000-person strong company with strategic partnerships with two of the world's leading automakers: Ford and Volkswagen. Our self-driving system is the first with commercial deployment plans for Europe and the U.S., and thanks to an ability to tap into both automakers' global reach, our technology platform has the largest geographic deployment potential of any self-driving technology to date.At Argo AI, we believe that embracing differences delivers superior results. html: SummarySave the Children‘s U.S. Rural Education programs help children in low-income, rural communities become kindergarten ready and achieve grade-level reading and math proficiency by third grade by employing diverse strategies such as home visits, play groups, in-school tutoring, out-of-school time programming, summer enrichment, family engagement, community events and more. and/or TableauProven experience with data analysis, visualization, and database developmentProfessional proficiency in spoken and written EnglishProven ability to successfully and proactively inform business groups by communicating data trendsProven success in an environment requiring a high degree of detail orientationProven ability to manage multiple competing prioritiesDemonstrated commitment to diversity, inclusion, and belongingPreferred QualificationsMonitoring & evaluation experienceExperience implementing Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA)-compliant data handling protocolsExperience working with education and child/youth program dataWhy you should join the Save the Children Team…Save the Children US offers outstanding benefits that include health, dental, vision and life insurances, pet insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an Employee Assistance Program, 403(b), generous vacation, personal sick leave, family leave, parental/adoption leave, commuter benefits, dress for your day, and much more.Click here to learn more about how Save the Children US will invest in YOUAbout Save the ChildrenSave the Children believes every child deserves a future. In the United States and around the world, we give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. We do whatever it takes for children – every day and in times of crisis – transforming their lives and the future we share.Our work for children and their families requires that we commit—at every opportunity—to work together to identify and dismantle persistent systemic and structural racism, inequality, and any other forms of discrimination in this country and beyond. As an anti-racist organization, Save the Children will not tolerate discrimination in any form—in our employment practices, amongst our staff, in our leadership or toward the people we serve. We stand in solidarity with all people to fight for equal rights, justice, inclusion, and belonging.We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, ancestry, sexual orientation, national origin, age, handicap, disability, marital status, or status as a veteran. Save the Children complies with all applicable laws.Save the Children is committed to conducting its programs and operations in a manner that is safe for the children it serves and helping protect the children with whom we are in contact. All Save the Children representatives are explicitly prohibited from engaging in any activity that may result in any kind of child abuse. In addition, it is Save the Children’s policy to create and proactively maintain an environment that aims to prevent and deter any actions and omissions, whether deliberate or inadvertent, that place children at the risk of any kind of child abuse. All our representatives are expected to conduct themselves in a manner consistent with this commitment and obligation.Save the Children is committed to minimizing safety and security risks for our valued employees, ensuring all are given training, support and information to reduce their risk exposure while maximizing the impact of our programs for children and families. Our shared duty, both agency and individual, is to seek and maintain safe working conditions for all.

html: Company DescriptionWe are the Twitter Service team, dedicated to delivering customer service through meaningful connections and enforcing policies to promote healthy exchanges in the public conversation. Whether we're optimizing support operations, guarding the health of the service through scaled enforcement, driving content and support channel strategies, or localizing the product for our global audience, we're with our customers every step of the way.Job DescriptionTwitter users generate many terabytes of data every day; The TwS analytics team is at the intersection of all this data and strives to make it actionable to all business units within TwS. Analytics team build real-time and offline solutions to make data accessible and reliable - and then apply them to the most critical and fundamental analytical problems to guide TwS business decisions via observational analyses, trend analyses, modeling, and new measurement strategies.What You’ll Do:We are trying to improve Twitter Service. To improve something, we need to be able to measure it. You will enable better measurements and ensure measurement accuracy so that we know where we are doing well and where we want to improve.You’ll partner with product, technology, and ops leaders to turn business problems into data problems and demonstrate creativity by using existing data to solve those problems. You have at least 8+ years of experience in applied data science and analytics, including hands-on development and deployment of predictive modeling/machine learning models.Collaborate w/business partners to identify opportunities, understand objectives, and rationalize efforts to support strategic business objectives w/ both short-term and long-term deliveries in an environment with high SLA expectations.Advanced - SQL , Python (descriptive / predictive models) and Tableau viz. Working knowledge of Hadoop, BigQuery, Presto, Vertica, ExcelOwn the end to end data science process, from initiation to deployment, and through ongoing communication and collaboration, sharing of results to partners and leadership.Drive personalization, real-time decision-making, causal inference, and predictive analytics capabilities through the application of Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, and Simulation in an agile development framework.Conduct quantitative analysis of experimental, and textual data to generate insights and drive decision making (ANOVA, Regression, Chi-Sq, AB, pre-post etc..)[Preferred] Ability to write Scalding job for data extraction and aggregation. Working knowledge of Data warehousing principlesWrite well documented code that can be shared and used across teams, and can scale to be used in existing productsYou will see a direct link between your work, TwS growth, and user satisfaction.Soft skills:Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences and to effectively collaborate within cross-functional teamsWe follow agile framework and processes. Hence, cross-functional collaboration, communication skills and a focus on delivering a great user experience are a mustYou should be comfortable managing work plans, timelines and milestonesYou have a sense of urgency, move quickly and ship thingsBonus Points:You're experienced in metrics and experiment-driven developmentExperience in statistical methodology (multivariate, time-series, experimental design, data mining, etc.)Industry experience (retail or service is a plus but not a prerequisite)Note: Potential exposure to sensitive or graphic content, including but not limited to vulgar language, violent threats, pornography, and other graphic images.QualificationsSoft skills:Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences and to effectively collaborate within cross-functional teamsWe follow agile framework and processes. html: Would you like to join a team where you can make a difference and have fun doing it? Join Florida Tile! For over sixty years, Florida Tile has consistently taken the lead as an innovator by implementing new technology, delivering high quality products and protecting our indoor and outdoor environments. We provide a wide range of benefits and a family-friendly work environment. If this sounds like what you’re looking for, apply to Florida Tile today!SUMMARY:The purpose of this position is to perform Business Analysis to assist the organization in data management. It will facilitate Florida Tile’s SKU management process as it relates to manufactured items, sourced items (including Cotto d’este), branch parts, third party, home center, intragroup, and any other SKU. In addition to data management this role will also be responsible for the analysis of process and continue to develop more effective ways to manage product launches from the material side, mass updates/changes to materials, and any other data project deemed necessary to operate at the highest level of efficiency.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Design and setup all SKU information working closely with marketing, purchasing, production and pricing teams to enter into SAP system ensuring accuracyItem setup for all, merchandising, samples, branch parts and other itemsResponsible for coordinating with marketing for all new product launches via completion of DIM Sheets.Maintain all SKUs within SAP by monitoring changes to packaging and any other variableVerify conditions for each SKU are correct before implementation of the SKUTroubleshoot any SKU order issue in a swift manner and handle any incoming IT tickets related to data in SAP for materialsProof all marketing material to ensure data in SAP matches and provide correct information as neededInvestigate any data issues related to production errors and versioning and fix as necessaryProvide reporting on material master and related data as requestedAdditional duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor's Degree requiredMinimum of 3 years of material master data work preferredData analysis skills requiredAdvanced MS Excel skills requiredMinimum of two years of experience work within SAP preferredEffective oral and written communication skills requiredExtreme attention to detailCustomer centric mindset a mustAbility to multitask requiredAbility to troubleshoot problems remotely via telephone or remote data connectionAbility to work well with others at all levels of the organizationFlorida Tile provides an array of benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Our comprehensive benefit program includes:Medical, Dental, and Vision PlansFlexible Spending AccountsEmployee Wellness ProgramEmployer Paid Short and Long Term DisabilityEmployer Paid Life InsuranceSupplemental Life, AD&D, Accident, and Critical Illness Coverage401(k) Retirement Plan and Employer Provided 401(k) MatchingTuition ReimbursementPaid Time OffFlorida Tile is committed to treating people fairly and respectfully, we are committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity in the people we hire, the manner in which they are trained, their selections for promotions and transfer, and in all other aspects of employment. Your ability and performance are the keys to your success here at Florida Tile, regardless of your age, race, color, marital status, sexual orientation, sex, religion, creed national origin, political ideology, veteran status, or the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability unrelated to the ability to perform the job, in accordance with applicable law.

html: Sr Analyst, Research - HBO MaxLocation New York, New YorkBusiness: TurnerPosition Type: Full TimeJob ID 181906BRCompany OverviewWarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.We won’t chase the market, we will define it. We will bring audiences a product that doesn’t exist today. We will do it because no other company can deliver our brands to consumers the way we can. We have the passion, the commitment and the support to be the best. Join our HBO Max team and show us your best.The JobTurner Services Inc. seeks a Sr. Analyst, Research for the Research – HBO Max department.The Warner Media HBO MAX DTC Research team aims to be trusted partners for our unique businesses through a lens that is unbiased and unfiltered. We objectively translate consumer voices to help make strategic business objectives and decisions.The team is looking for a Senior Analyst, Research, to be a part of the HBO MAX/HBO Research team. The Senior Analyst will implement and guide the direction of market research studies, with focus on Customer Satisfaction research. They should also be versed across research methodologies (quantitative and qualitative,) especially quantitative analyses and first party data analysis.The DailyThe Senior Analyst will work on a suite of Customer Service (CSAT) tracking-based research for HBO MAX.They will be vitally involved in the day to day management, logistics, execution, data analysis and data reporting.They will need to work closely with their manager, stakeholders and Research colleagues to understand top business issues to ensure appropriate research is being conducted to provide consumer insights and surveys are appropriately reflective of business issues.The EssentialsManage research studies, including sampling, questionnaire development and execution.Manage the research study process including timelines, analytic plans, development and deliverables.Update tracker questionnaires on a timely basis to address new business issues.Analyze data and develop quick turn-around deliverables that are visual, concise and easily digestible.Evaluate and summarize research results; develop insightful and actionable recommendations and present findings.Partner with other members of the Research team to combine CSAT results with other tracking and research studiesPartner with Data Analytics to cross survey-based data with internal first party data sources and analyze that data.Assist in development of research plans and strategies that translate business goals into research objectives and studies.Develop strong relationships and maintain regular communication with internal stakeholders and Research colleagues.Assist in the management of the budget including ensuring timely processing of invoices.Help manage vendor relationships.Bachelor’s Degree required. Previous entertainment or streaming video experience preferred.Minimum of 3 years of primary consumer market research experience.Prior experience developing and managing tracking research, particularly customer satisfaction and tracking research.Knowledge of a broad range of quantitative and qualitative research techniques and methodologies.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and strategic thinking ability.Expert proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word.Analytical problem-solving skills, including the ability to break down data/information into meaningful findings and develop recommendations that lead to informed decision-making.Ability to synthesize information and produce insightful and accurate analyses and recommendations.Ability to use a data-driven approach to problem solving and scaling.Be adept at data visualization to tell story of insights in a clear and digestible way.Ability to work in a fast-paced high-pressure environment without sacrificing accuracy and attention to detail; strong project management skills are essential.Proficiency in statistical analysis software tools (e.g. SPSS) ideal.Proficiency in SQL ideal.Ability and strong interest to learn new data software tools.Excellent organizational skills.Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills.Ability to work independently on multiple projects simultaneously.Flexibility to adapt to changing and growing environment.High degree of integrity and professionalism and strong commitment to quality and accuracyA passion for the brands and a thirst to do more with less, to work smarter not harder.Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
title: Sr Analyst Research - HBO Max

html: SummaryPosted: Dec 11, 2020Weekly Hours: 40Role Number:200210154The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that has revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading services and customer experiences. We invite you to join us in that journey!Apple is looking to hire an outstanding Data Analyst with strong technical analytical skills to lead the effort for scalable data enrichment in music metadata. This includes analyzing input data sources, measuring data quality impact, identifying data anomalies, running validation exercises and experimenting with data science to drive improvements. This person will collaborate very closely and cross-functionally with Engineering, Product Management, Analytics and other teams to ensure success.Key Qualifications5+ years experience as a data analyst or data scientistTechnical proficiency with SQL and relational databasesExperience with querying in Hadoop, e.g. SparkExperience with a programming language, e.g. PythonExperience with Excel to slice and dice dataExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsStrong communication skills and ability to work closely with othersDemonstrated ability working with multiple teams to complete critical achievements under pressure with tight deadlinesStrong understanding of large-scale content management systems and data modeling strongly preferredExperience with data science and machine learning preferredHistory of working with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, preferredDescription- Analyze, inspect and create reports against various data sources in Hadoop, SQL, csv- Identify patterns from data anomalies to help improve data quality- Define metrics and evaluations that help measure data health- Handle, track and measure quality from manual data validation exercises- Identity opportunities for automation of processes- Experiment with machine learning to improve data quality- Collaborate cross-functionally across many teams- Help improve how features are built and executed across teams- Create clear and concise documentationEducation & ExperienceBS degree, preferably with a technical background
title: Data Analyst

html: Ally and Your CareerAlly Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that's more than some cliche people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You're constantly evolving, so shouldn't your opportunities be, too?The OpportunityThis position will assist the DP&S business unit in achieving the product/project goals by providing configuration services including requirement gathering, system configuration, user acceptance testing, implementation and post-implementation support. This role requires the ability to provide configuration services as prioritized by the configuration manager and/or team leader while establishing a collaborative one-team approach to accomplishing all product development through delivery goals.The Work ItselfApply overall knowledge of DP&S products requirements to product development through delivery processGather product requirements from DP&S Product Development teamAssist in product related configuration developmentExecute configuration programming in test and production environmentsAssist with unit testing of the system configurationProvide defect resolution and support during system testing and user acceptance testingAssist with the development of the User Acceptance Test Plan on Product ReleasesPerform production support analysis on defects submitted to the configuration teamPerform SME role in system related projectsThe Skills You BringBachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Information Science, Computer Science or similar background preferredExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsCustomer service skillsHigh level of accountabilityKnowledge of strategic planning, business planning, and research/analysis processesTechnical skills and experience with software applications including:MS Access, Excel, PowerPoint and WordOracle SQLVisual BasicPrefer knowledge of the CPS/iWarranty suite of systemsStrong organizational, analytical and interpersonal skillsAbility to work across cultures and functionsHow We'll Have Your BackAlly's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But Ally's total compensation - or total rewards - extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including:Time Away: competitive holiday and flexible paid-time-off, including time off for volunteering and voting.Planning for the Future: plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan and 529 educational assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, and other financial well-being programs.Supporting your Health & Well-being: flexible health and insurance options including dental and vision, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally and financially.Building a Family: adoption, surrogacy, and fertility support as well as parental and caregiver leave, back-up child and adult/elder day care program and child care discounts.Work-Life Integration: other benefits including LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs.Who We AreAlly Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com.Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. For accommodation requests, email us at work@ally.com. Ally will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.

html: Locations considered for this opening:B-F Headquarters office in Louisville, KYB-F Regional office in Atlanta, GALocations across the US for a remote work from home set-upWhy does this job exist?The Business Analyst role will provide expertise for implementing and supporting collaborative technologies at Brown Forman with a primary focus on the USA & Canada Region. This role will work with B-F business users to select and implement collaborative technology solutions that enable users to be more effective and efficient. These solutions will be created from a mixture of B-F corporate and region specific tools. Corporate tools include: Salesforce.com, Tableau, G Suite, and Boomi. Will also act as a change agent for USA&C Region as these new technologies are deployed.What You Can Expect:Gather requirements, evaluate, assess and select a technology that meets the requirements and is compatible with existing systems and B-F IT’s strategy.Create solutions that are quick to build, easy to roll out, intuitive and most of all relevant to the business.Develop and maintain a professional knowledge of new and emerging trends in software and hardware technologies.Create and maintain relationships with business users so that new ideas and technologies can be introduced easilyWork with the rest of the global teams to share and employ best practice across all regions.Work to upskill the US&C Region on B-F technology capabilities.Execution:Under general supervision, serve as the in-house “expert” responsible for collaborative technologies design, implementation, testing and support.Partner with the business to understand how their technology needs can be satisfied with solutions built using BF IT’s chosen technologies.These technologies will include, but not be limited to: Salesforce.com, Tableau, G Suite, and Boomi.Support the execution of technology implementation initiatives, within the accepted time lines, budgets and resources.Project Management:While full project management skills are not required, the ability to track and report out on the active tasks is necessary.Support/Training:Responsible for training and supporting B-F users across the world.Communicate new ideas and technologies to B-F employees so those ideas can be used to solve existing problems.Investigate and solve complex problems by documenting solutions and transferring knowledge to business users.Capabilities Needed To Be Successful:Understanding of analytics visualization tools and concepts such as Business Objects, Tableau, Power BI or similar.Experience with multiple social media technologies.Microsoft Office - Excel, Powerpoint and Word.Google Apps - Sites, Docs and Search.Understanding of Salesforce Platform development strategies.We Are Looking For People With:Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related field.3+ years applicable business experience.Strong interpersonal skills.Excellent communication skills-both written and verbal, and the ability to present difficult concepts in understandable terms to all levels of the organization.Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies.Desire to implement new technology or procedures to streamline complex business process.Comfortable with all levels of company personnel.Self-confidence to manage change.What Makes You Unique:Strong preference for Data Modeling, Data Visualization, and Data Literacy experience.Salary Grade: 26Reports to: Manager, Regional Technology#LI-AP2#LI-remoteBrown-Forman Corporation is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. It is the policy of Brown-Forman Corporation to provide full and equal employment opportunities to all employees and potential employees without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, veteran status, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability or any other legally protected status.Business Area: Global Information TechnologyCity: LouisvilleState: KentuckyCountry: USAReq ID: JR-00002037

html: The RoleThe Data Analyst in SQA will analyze data from software usage throughout the development lifecycle to ensure that Akili delivers high quality experience to users, and has the data needed to continue to do so.ResponsibilitiesTranslate requirements and expected behaviors into scalable testing methodologies rooted in usage/telemetry data:Expand coverage of data-oriented test cases within the overall SQA testing portfolioIdentify gaps in data capture needed to execute theses cases efficientlyDevelop, and partner with engineering to automate, repeatable analyses to execute these cases within development and testing cyclesInvestigate issues or anomalies in usage data to assess severity and ascertain causesImprove processes to monitor production data for unexpected or undesired behaviors of users or the softwareWork with analytics and data science teams to track and continuously validate assumptions used in downstream processing, and define processes to handle inconsistencies that ariseQualifications3-5 years querying and analyzing with usage/telemetry data from consumer software (both web and mobile preferred, mobile game experience ideal)2+ years developing test cases for consumer software (at least some relating directly to data-oriented validation)Highly proficient in SQLProficient with Python/Pandas (preferred) or R for munging and investigating data setsBonus: experience handling sensitive data (e.g. health care) within a compliance frameworkAbout AkiliAt Akili Interactive, our mission is to ignite new hope for those living with cognitive impairment. We're bringing together world-class neuroscience with the latest technology and video game entertainment to create a new class of digital medicines, delivered through captivating video game experiences. We are out to prove that effective medicine for serious illnesses can also be fun and engaging.Our flagship product, EndeavorRx, is the first ever FDA-cleared prescription treatment delivered through a video game to treat children living with ADHD. This is only the beginning, as we continue to boldly challenge the status quo of today's medicine.Diversity and InclusionDiversity and inclusion are incredibly important to all of us. We are committed to hearing all voices. Akili Interactive provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.
title: Data Analyst in SQA

html: We are:Wix’s Account Management organization - we’re responsible for offering personalized recommendations for Wix users. We’re obsessed with enabling small and large businesses to create extraordinary online experiences for their clients using our platform. We’re on a mission to continue establishing Wix as the ultimate solution for scaling online businesses and strengthening our position as a leader in the industry.We’re looking for a Data Analyst to help us scale effectively by giving visibility and insights, creating and adjusting team metrics, and making sure that all our decisions are well informed. This role is part of a dynamic, quickly growing, and entrepreneurial team.You are:Vastly experienced (3+ years) with very large data sets and quantitative analysis, preferably for a web or mobile company. You’re an expert in SQL and have strong analytical skills, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to draw meaningful insights from large amounts of data. You thrive under ambiguity and are able to apply critical thinking to new unsolved questions.You take a problem-solving approach to everything and know how to put your business judgment and strategic thinking to work in a fast-paced field. You thrive in the place where data, product, and marketing meet. Plus, you’re an excellent communicator with great time management skills and a passion for analytics and data.As a Data Analyst, you will:Work closely with our account management and sales organizations to understand processes, and how we help address client needs and product pain points.Develop and run analyses, experiments, reports, and more to enhance our user journey understanding, reveal new insights, and identify opportunities.Analyze and process tons of data, and use it to give actionable insights to the business, with the end goal of driving growth and engagement.Produce automated tools and dashboards to support understanding of key sales and product metrics for various stakeholders and leadership.Collaborate cross-functionally with different teams and stakeholders to design, execute, measure, and improve the impact of our sales efforts.
title: Data Analyst
