html: The MDM Product File Analyst is globally responsible for working with Service Centers, Field Management, Vendors, Product Management, Supply Chain, and IT to analyze data in order to maximize revenue and operating efficiency as it pertains to all material related master data and material price records. The Master Data Analyst will be involved in designing and enforcing Global Data Governance rules and standards to maintain data integrity, problem solving and resolution for an array of data related issues, and providing consulting expertise to business partners.JOB DUTIESWork with supplier contacts and Product Management for information required to accurately and timely set-up, maintain, cleanse, and ensure all aspects of correct material master data, including the SAP material master, material price records, CMIRs, interchange records, PIRs, source lists, and consignment records, through agile analysis to drive efficient and effective sales processes.Perform root-cause analysis on master data inconsistencies. Recommend and execute corrective action.Routinely audit data against established rule sets to ensure consistency and accuracy of information. Work with supplier contacts and business partners to resolve any discrepancies in data.Support SAP deployments across the company by ensuring the data cleansing meets the global and business specific standards.Identify process improvement opportunities to maximize revenue and operating efficiency.Develop knowledge and expertise of best practices and end-to-end business processes involving master data.Help to develop standard procedures, user guides, and other necessary training and job aid materials. Provide training / coaching as needed.Validate and process vendor product files, performing all necessary levels of SAP maintenance, including creating and maintaining material price records, new adds, creating substitution tables, maintaining accurate values and statuses.Research the root cause of errors, process, and data integrity issues and provide resolution.Assist in leading process standardization, data governance, cleansing activities, maintenance and data quality improvement efforts in alignment with data strategy goals.Enable the team to drive efficient, accurate set-up through understanding Microsoft Access, WinShuttle, and other technical capabilities.Support Company acquisitions via file conversions.Follow-up with vendors to expedite and obtain pricing and product data.Play a key role with the design, testing, and implementation of new process and/or enhancements to the systems that support master data.Perform other duties as assigned or directed.EDUCATION/ EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:Equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field preferred.Up to 1 year of relevant experience or equivalent.Excellent computer skills: Access, Excel, Power Point, etc.Ability to work with a team as well as independently.Strong interpersonal skills; positive business relationships.Effective written and verbal communication skills including proper English grammar.Solid analytical & problem solving skills.Process orientation, detail focus, ability to multi-task.Results oriented. Self-Motivated. Ability to handle stress & deadlines.Applied Industrial Technologies (NYSE: AIT) is a leading value-added distributor and technical solutions provider of industrial motion, fluid power, flow control, automation technologies, and related maintenance supplies. Our leading brands, specialized services, and comprehensive knowledge serve MRO and OEM end users in virtually all industrial markets through our multi-channel capabilities that provide choice, convenience, and expertise.We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, protected veteran status, marital status, medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.If you need accommodation for any part of the employment process because of a disability, please send an email to hiring@applied.com or call 216-426-4389 to let us know the nature of your request.

Through a culture of support, respect, inclusion, teamwork, and a good dose of humor, we empower excellent employees. Join us in making a difference.At PRC, we value:Quality. And, here’s who we’re looking for:What does Data Analyst at PRC do?As an entry level position, the Data Analyst ensures the quality of data by compiling survey data, performing quality control, and sharing data with internal and external users.More specifically, they…Perform quality assurance and quality control of data.Use internal and external programs, perform statistical analysis, significance testing, regression, correlations, and discriminant, as needed.Provide support to Research Analysts, Coding, Project Management, and Account Management.Provide data files/reporting to clients, internal and external.Troubleshoot and problem solve posted data from internal programs.Participate in team planning and forecasting.Create and maintain documentation of statement of procedures.Collaborate with internal PRC departments to assess client needs, representing the department during the life of the study.What does a Data Specialist at PRC need?KnowledgeBachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience required. Psychology, Sociology, Community Health, Public Administration preferred; other majors considered.Experience with Microsoft Office, and statistical software such as R, SPSS, or SAS for analyzing large data sets.Experience in SQL and relational databases is beneficial.Skills and AbilitiesAptitude for computers and technical systems.Critical thinking skills. title: Program Analyst

html: Join a high-performing, tight-knit team at a fast-growing company that is using the Internet of Things (IoT) to transform how organizations sense, monitor, and make decisions. Founded out of MIT in 2005, SmartSense by Digi is trusted by more than 4,000 organizations, including Walmart, SpaceX, Apple, CVS Health, Coca-Cola, and the US State Department to help them make sensor-driven decisions.We are building next-generation IoT products and infrastructure that helps companies measure their world, transmit their valuable metrics to a centralized location, alert when there is something to be concerned about, and even predict key events before they happen. Our customers rely on our solution every day to make mission critical decisions; we are looking for team-oriented change agents to help shape the future of IoT.SmartSense is built for this moment in history. We provide CDC mandated temperature monitoring to more than 28,000 locations that administer the extremely temperature-sensitive COVID-19 vaccines. This includes all of the nation’s largest retail pharmacies. We could not be prouder of our role in bringing the COVID-19 vaccine to the public and are looking for passionate team members that want to be part of our mission of solving critical business challenges using IoT technologies.SmartSense is seeking a full-time Data Analyst to help us bring new data products to the market by generating insights from our IoT sensor data, then building effective reports and visualizations to allow the insights to improve decision-making. The initial focus of the position will be in expanding our reporting suite by developing Tableau visualizations and building familiarity with our data. The role will expand to contributing to analytics projects: understanding a business question, developing a plan for using data to address it, implementing metrics and reports as reports and evaluating with end users, and communicating results to internal and external customers. We are looking for an intellectually curious individual with a love for data and analytics, bringing some SQL and coding experience, and with either a strong technical or statistical background. We will provide mentorship, interesting challenges both technical and creative, and best of all plenty of data in this role ripe for someone hungry to develop broad analytics skills and deliver new products to the market.This role joins a team based in Boston but the role can be remote for someone working Eastern time zone hours. A candidate in the Mishawaka, Indiana SmartSense office would be ideal for the potential to become a presence for our team in the SmartSense office there.Required SkillsExperience and interest in developing data visualizations, ideally in Tableau or similar platformSQL proficiencyPython proficiencyHighly Desirable SkillsPython expertiseAdvanced SQL, query optimizationDataBricks or other scaling platformsJavascriptHTML5Git

title: BI Analyst

html: From our founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to make access to data as simple and reliable as electricity. With Fivetran, your data just arrives in your warehouse, canonical and ready to query, no engineering or maintenance required. As we watch more and more companies leverage our technology to become truly data-driven, we're proud not only of our growth but also of the fact that we've grown without compromising our core values.Integrity.We do the right thing, even when it's harder in the short run. We challenge the status quo by reasoning from first principles.Initiative.Fivetran belongs to all of us. We take ownership and are accountable for getting things done. Through curiosity, learning, and coaching, we grow as individuals and teams.One team, one dream.We share the pains and successes of our customers, partners and colleagues. We seek, gather, and trust a diverse group of teammates with different perspectives to guide Fivetran's progress.If these values resonate with you, we'd love to hear from you.The RoleThe Analytics team is searching for a Senior Data Analyst who will collaborate with the People Leadership to find innovative ways to deliver meaningful metrics, trends, key insights, and analysis in clear, concise stories for various stakeholders in HR, Recruiting, DEI and Learning & Development. This person will have a solid understanding of the employee life cycle, understands recruiting and HR workflows, and is a pro at SQL and building analytics dashboards for People Teams. You will be a key contributor in identifying and improving processes that support efficiency and scalability of our HRIS, troubleshooting systems issues, and developing standard People analytics procedures. This is a new role at Fivetran, so you will have an opportunity to really shape the future of Fivetran's People Analytics. If you are passionate about data and want to help empower the People team to ensure a stellar employee experience and provide critical insights to leadership to guide future business decisions, then, this is the role for you.As a Senior Analyst in People Operations at Fivetran, you will:Own all People Operations analytics (HR, Recruiting, DEI and L&D)Translate data and trends into stories to drive business decisionsDevelop, test and validate analytics dashboards for various business partners and leaders so they can easily draw insights and recommendations (We use Looker dashboards, powered by Fivetran!)Partner with internal / external stakeholders to understand requirements for report requests, understand data structures, availability and reporting limitationsTrain and educate stakeholders on people data metrics and dashboardsSupport new system implementations from discovery to launch and partner cross functionally with IT to help design and build out People analytics data warehouseAudit data integrity, investigate concerns, and establish processes to streamline and improve data qualityMaintain HRIS/ATS hygiene and protocol to support accurate reporting, making recommendations on improvements along the way (Currently, we use Namely as our HRIS and Greenhouse as our ATS)What you'll bring to the table:4+ years of experience in advanced SQL3+ years of experience in data modeling and creating analytics dashboards (we use Looker!)Strong experience creating and maintaining custom People Analytics dashboards that are flexible to the dynamic natures of working with multiple departmentsAdvanced experience in HR reporting, preferably also in Recruiting reportingWorking knowledge of multiple Human Resources reporting systems and how to successfully run multi system reportsBasic knowledge of HR policies and lawsAbility to work with multiple stakeholders, including executives and C-Suite, translate their needs into data solutions and follow up on solutions to meet their needsComfortability in analyzing data, creating reports, and leading quarterly meetings on HR and Recruiting metrics to leadership teams in an effort to provide solutions and raise awareness to current and potential problemsEmotional intelligence, cultural sensitivity, and a 'one team, one dream' mindsetBenefits and Compensation:100% paid Medical, Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance. Benefits begin on your first day!Option of Health Savings Account (HSA) or Flexible Savings Account (FSA)Generous paid time off (PTO) plus paid sick time, holidays, parental leave, and volunteer days off401k match programEligible donation match programMonthly cell phone stipendWork-from-home equipment reimbursement for your home office setup!Professional development and training opportunitiesCompany virtual happy hours and fun team building activitiesPet Insurance - and yes, you can bring your well-behaved fur babies to workCommuter benefits to help with transit and parking costsShaped by the real-world needs of data analysts, Fivetran technology is the smartest, fastest way to replicate your applications, databases, events and files into a high-performance cloud warehouse. Fivetran connectors deploy in minutes, require zero maintenance, and automatically adjust to source changes — so your data team can stop worrying about engineering and focus on driving insights. To learn more about Fivetran's culture and what it's like to be part of the team, click here and enjoy our video.To learn more about our candidate privacy policy, you can read our statement here.
title: Lead Data Analyst People Analytics

html: Wealthfront is the leader in the vision to deliver financial optimization and automation to everyone. Data and its proper use is crucial to that vision and the data science team plays a fundamental role in understanding and interpreting those data sources.The Wealthfront data science team creates data products to deliver optimized and personalized financial advice, develops best in class investment algorithms, and analyzes our rich financial and behavioral data to make key business decisions. The team draws from a variety of backgrounds in Computer Science & Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Math, Operations Research, and Financial Engineering. We derive strength from this diversity and are constantly learning and teaching each other in a down-to-earth and dynamic environment. We are neither too big where you would be just another cog in the system, nor are we too small that none of our efforts can be realized.As a Senior Data Analyst in Wealthfront’s Data Science organization, you’ll be responsible for improving the quality of our decisions using data and the scientific method. You will analyze data to generate insights that inform product, marketing, and other business decisions throughout the company and across the product lifecycle, from ideation and research to launch and iteration. You will collaborate with your data science colleagues with a focus on technical skills and career development. We are fortunate to work with experienced product managers and engineers that have worked on products at companies like Facebook, Google, Twitter and Apple. This is an opportunity to learn from some of the most experienced operators in the startup world and to further an important and meaningful mission. Our Data Science team focuses on product analytics (for the product areas of Investments, Banking, financial automation) , A/B Testing, and growth/marketing analytics.What you'll do:Answer business questions from product and marketing using available big data such as financial transactions, web/mobile product interactions, and marketing campaign responses.Collaborate with data scientists with advanced knowledge of machine learning and statistics to answer business questions.Develop a strong understanding of our datasetsTake initiative to create new insights that will improve products or growth/marketing initiatives.What we're looking for:You subscribe to Wealthfront’s values and mission and can articulate the reasons why, and have an understanding of our product, business model and key metricsAbility to work with product managers and marketing to understand their analytical needs and communicate results clearly, both verbally and in writingAbility to access, transform, visualize, and model datasets with minimal engineering support using expert level SQL and intermediate level statistics (descriptive statistics, common pitfalls, NHST, A/B testing)Ability to conduct exploratory analysis where documentation about data is not completeAbility to pre-process data: data cleaning and deriving new featuresVisualization using tools like Excel, Tableau, and ShinyBachelor’s degree in analytical discipline (e.g., Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science) plus 2+ years of industry experienceAbility to collaborate with data scientists who may work on more complex components of the business analysisDesirable to have: some knowledge of machine learning (regression, classification, clustering), data pipelines written in Scala/Spark, programming in Python and/or R, and a Master’s degreeEveryone across the financial spectrum deserves to live secure and rewarding lives. In order to successfully serve clients across the United States, the Wealthfront team is focused on hiring team members with a diverse range of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.About WealthfrontWealthfront is a nextgen banking and investing service. We offer high-interest checking with our Cash Account, help you build your net worth with automated investing, automate your savings strategy with our service Autopilot, and give you a single view of your finances with our intuitive mobile app.Our ultimate vision is to optimize and automate all of our clients’ finances and build what we call Self-Driving Money™️. We want clients to be able to automatically deposit their paycheck into their Wealthfront account, and let us take care of the rest — paying their bills, topping off their emergency fund or 401(k), and investing the rest based on their specific goals and lifestyle. To get there, we’ll be focusing the bulk of our efforts on creating a better alternative to what the banking industry provides. Join us so you can help us turn this industry on its head and build a service that our clients don't just like, they love.
title: Senior Data Analyst

html: SteelHouse's mission is to create performance marketing that performs all from one beautiful user interface. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at SteelHouse are builders at heart. Our team is constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to truly connect marketers and their customers in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger marketing interactions — we're just getting started.As a BI Analyst you will take the lead in developing products and reporting tools as a part of the Data team. The responsibilities of this crucial SteelHouse team are to create reporting tools, integrate reporting platforms, and generally bring life to the numbers for our clients and internal teams. As the data expert, the Data Analyst will report directly to the Data Team Lead and consult with executives from finance to product and every department in between. The ideal candidate understands how integral their role is to the success of the business as a whole and has a talent for seeing the big picture. We are looking for a strong, motivated, team-oriented individual, who is a gifted communicator with the ability to adapt their message to unique audiences. You Will:Become the expert on the SteelHouse platforms, UI, databases, and data pipelinesAnalyze and audit data for data or business integrity, and to recommend/forecast insights associated with our product iterationsManage data, reports, integrations, and users of our DOMO applicationCreate internal revenue, finance, product, performance reporting for larger company wide decisionsYou Have:A bachelor's degree in a quantitative/analytical or marketing field (preferred)2-4 years experience in data analytics or similarExperience with SQL database query writingExperience using Domo, Tableau or similar BI tools for reporting and visualizationAdvanced Excel and analytical skills requiredDemonstrated ability to interpret in-depth analyses, uncover actionable insight and effectively communicate to the broader organizationA strong mentality for problem solvingStrong communication and presentation skillsA self-starter personality and willing to work in an intense but fun environmentAssertive, ambitious, leadership qualities and can take charge when necessaryAn excellent ability to multi-task, are extremely detail oriented, and able to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment characterized by growth and changeThe gig comes with a few perks:100% RemoteCollaborative work environment with friendly peopleTransparency-we share very detailed financial info at company meetingsCompetitive compensation100% healthcare coverageOpen-ended vacation policy with an annual vacation stipend401k planFlexible Spending Account (FSA) for dependent, medical and dental careAbout SteelHouseSteelHouse provides advertising software for brands to reach their audience across Connected TV, web, and mobile. SteelHouse Performance TV has redefined what it means to advertise on television, transforming Connected TV into a direct response, performance marketing channel. Our web retargeting has been leveraged by thousands of top brands for over a decade, driving billions of dollars in revenue.Our solutions give advertisers total transparency and complete control over their campaigns – all with the fastest go-live in the industry. Thousands of top brands have partnered with SteelHouse, including Virgin America, TUMI, Staples, Beachbody, and others.

html: Analysts ensure that AAA Life Insurance makes effective business and operational decisions. As an Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios, tracking performance metrics or building metrics that matter, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. Working on multiple projects at a time, you'll focus on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges. You'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes, as well as provide executive level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.This role is a blend of client service, strategic consulting, and analytics delivery. It requires strong analytic skills, technical aptitude, ability to communicate effectively, and a passion for continuous improvement. Associate Analysts build consultative relationships with internal and external clients, develop expertise with industry leading tools and methodologies, and are able to apply statistical methods to solve complex business challenges.Position ResponsibilitiesDevelop automated, easy to understand reports and ad hoc analyses that effectively answer questions, identify patterns and highlight opportunities for improvement or action.Analyze data to evaluate process effectiveness and sales performance across multiple dimensions (campaigns, channels, applications, sales, etc.). Make optimization recommendations to business partners and teams to improve performance.Develop and execute processes that leverage statistical methods to optimize business outcomes. Work with Data Scientists to identify and prioritize new opportunities to deploy advanced analytics.Proactively seek out new opportunities to increase sales, reduce costs, and improve internal processes. Understands business drivers and activities. title: Analyst

html: Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.As a Senior Data Analyst, you will help build our data analytics vertical and drive insights that lead to step-function operational improvements in the business. In this role, you will partner with leadership and teams from across the business — from our Tower and Drone teams to operations to our customer success team — to help unpack ambiguous problems and build lasting, scalable analytics solutions. Your work will vary from deep analytical investigations to process and data improvements and helping build core dashboards and tables — all in the pursuit of helping grow how Anduril operates and measures itself.Required QualificationsProficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex and nuanced queries against new or unfamiliar data sets (and if you’re not proficient, you have the aptitude and ambition to become fluent!)Experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Sisense)Comfortable working with, and combining, disparate and diverse data sourceso4+ years of experience in roles as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Management Consultant, Investment BankingYou think deeply about business strategy, growth, and metrics and have experience translating opportunities into data driven problemsYou are excited about partnering with coworkers to figure out how analytics can solve business problems while displaying the EQ and humility to draw stakeholders inYou are excellent at project managing your work and have experience boiling data problems into measurable and achievable blocksYou know how to communicate complex concepts effectively and concisely and are comfortable presenting and debating in large groups. We’re looking for strong data advocates who can plug into cross-functional working teams seamlessly and drive cultural pushes for the organization to become more data drivenResponsibilitiesBe the first Senior Data Analyst hire at Anduril!Help lead the charge on building out our internal data infrastructure and driving towards insights that lead to step-function improvements in how we operateOwn the analyses and projects with cross functional teams that lead to improvements in our understanding of the business. This will be done through analyses that you are directly working on and by helping cross-functional partners answer their own questionsDefine and introduce new metrics and processes that drive clarity into business performance by helping us understand where we’re succeeding and where we need to improveDeeply care about how Anduril uses the output of your analysis, and strive to make us improve over timeU.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will require the ability to access U.S. only data systems and export controlled data.
title: Senior Data Analyst

Angie's List also helps service professionals grow their business by providing individualized advertising packages, providing a platform for previous customers to review completed projects and connecting them with homeowners browsing for their next project.The Sales Operations Analyst is responsible for maintaining, improving, and creating tools and processes to be used by the Angie's List Client Success and Sales Originations teams. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEPossession of a Bachelor's degree or better in Finance, Business Analytics, Economics or a related field, is preferredPrevious business analyst experience is preferredStrong experience with MS Office, particularly ExcelWorking knowledge of Salesforce and SQL is a plusExcellent communication skills are required, both written and spokenStrong computer skills requiredAbility to work in a metric driven environment and remain goal orientedKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Skills in complex problem solving, judgment, critical thinking and decision makingAbility to be highly organized with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness, and have attention to detail to accurately follow proceduresAbility to maintain self-motivation and work alone with minimum supervision, and with others in a team environment, occasionally under time pressure and on several tasks at the same timeAbility to effectively communicate orally and in writing with co-workers, management team, other Departments, vendors, and outside agencies, including being sensitive to professional ethicsAbility to sit the entire work day viewing a computer monitorAbility to work occasionally more than 40 hours a week, evenings, and weekends to meet deadlinesCompensation & Benefits:This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package.Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needsFlexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need itPet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

html: This position reports to the Director of Information Technology and is responsible for operational aspects associated with data quality, use, and reporting within the context of health and health care. This position develops and executes plans, policies, and practices that control, protect, deliver, and enhance the value and integrity of the company's data and information assets for addressing needs to support high quality healthcare delivery. This position also conducts health data quality assurance, evaluation, and reporting. This role includes monitoring and maintaining the quality of the company's databases, which encompass data from a multitude of healthcare and public health data sources, generating operational reports, analyzing data, and troubleshooting discrepancies.Essential Duties:Assists with creating controls to preserve the integrity of the information being reported for supporting clinical and public health needs.Generates reports on operational and project-based metrics.Monitors the quality, based on healthcare data standards, of the company's data and information, reports on results, and recommends corrective action plans and alternative methods for administration.Works with multi-disciplinary team to investigate patterns or trends within data.Investigates data quality problems, conducts root-cause analysis, corrects errors, develops process improvement processes, and evaluates impact of improvements for addressing clinical and public health challenges.In partnership with program managers, works with health and healthcare business partners on data anomalies and requests for information.Works with vendors for evaluation of data reporting enhancements to meet company and healthcare community needs.Thoroughly documents processes related to data analysis, quality, and reporting.Performs other related duties and special projects as assigned.Minimum Qualifications:A BA/BS degree in a quantitative field of study, such as Applied Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science.Two years' experience in business or health data management and reporting, data analytics, or data stewardship.Experience in data science skills (i.e., general purpose, statistical, and database programming).Experience with systems analysis to ensure optimal use of data assets to meet company needs.Basic system administration skills, including MS Windows and Linux environments.Experience with working with and securely managing sensitive data.Intermediate to advanced MS Excel skills including conditional statements, complex/nested formulas, charts and graphs, pivot tables, lookups, filtering, auditing tools, arrays, etc. Knowledge of VBA is a plus.Experience with working with healthcare data (e.g., electronic health record, healthcare claims, public health data) is a plus.High comfort level in manipulating and querying large data sets. Relational database management experience (e.g., MS SQL Server), as well as general purpose (e.g., Python or Julia) and statistical programming (e.g., R), strongly preferred.Desired Qualifications:Knowledge and understanding of computer systems/applications. Experience with analysis and documenting user requirements.Experience in documenting system operation (user guides), developing test scripts and scenarios, and executing user testing.Proven record of understanding the tracking of information as it relates to Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).Experience with working on data analyses associated with research projects, including participating in manuscript development and supporting federal grant-led initiatives, is a plus.Strong problem analysis and problem-solving skills. Comfortable working with complex data and resolving ambiguous issues.Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to interpret technical language and translate for non-technical audiences.Healthcare background desirable.General Requirements:Performs quality work within deadlines with or without direct supervision.Ability to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment and handle multiple tasks.Establishes and maintains effective working relationships.Supports and adheres to RIQI's core values and corporate culture.Represents RIQI in a positive manner to all stakeholders.Performs as a team player.Self-starter; energetic; can-do attitude.Metrics mindset.Rhode Island Quality Institute is an EEO/AA Employer.PI130632310

html: JOB DESCRIPTIONPosition Summary The Data Analyst works with data domain leads and business teams to test and validate business data to be used in the new system environment, including data coming from legacy environments. This EVEREST ERP program role designs and executes approaches to modify data to align with agreed-upon standards. Working with the DDL’s and the Data Cleansing & Validation Lead, this role works to ensure local country data comply with standards, error-free. The role ensures that data is mapped in line with ERP program timelines, and that mapping is properly checked and validated.COMPANY OVERVIEWNashville, Tenn.-based Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, the world's largest tire and rubber company. Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand tires to address the needs of a broad range of customers, including consumers, automotive and commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturers, and those in the agricultural, forestry and mining industries. The companies are also engaged in retreading operations throughout the Western Hemisphere and produce air springs, roofing materials, and industrial fibers and textiles. The Bridgestone Americas family of companies also operates the world's largest chain of automotive tire and service centers.Guided by its global corporate social responsibility (CSR), commitment 'Our Way to Serve,' Bridgestone embraces its responsibility as a global leader by striving to improve the way people move, live, work and play.RESPONSIBILITIESWork with Data Domain Leads to create user requirements and acceptance criteriaResponsible for executing changes to improve the quality of business data to agreed standardsSupport to the Data Cleansing & Validation Lead to ensure local country data are maintained and created to defined standardsEnsures that global solution fits to the local data requirementsDelivers local functional data execution and data mappingDelivers data construction, data extraction and manual conversions in accordance to global templatesEnsures master data identification, quality and cleansing on legacy systems in accordance to project timelinesTests and validates extracts and converted data in test and deploy (authority and operational knowledge of data)QUALIFICATIONSStrong understanding of the data relevant to their Business ProcessUnderstanding of data quality and cleansing processesProactive at identifying and correcting data Quality issuesDetail oriented to confirm transformation logic was applied correctly and capture data defects Bachelor’s degreeMinimum five years of work experience within Data or related fieldExperience training or coaching others on processesPreferred Qualifications:Strong knowledge of information management, data quality & governance frameworksUnderstanding of standard data governance, data management, metadata management, and automation toolsExcellent interpersonal and communication skills with a proven ability to communicate effectively and confidently at all levels Clear process improvement focus, systematic and organized.Strong analytical skills: able to analyze problems and devise viable solutions.Data testing and validation experience preferredSAP experience preferred, specifically with Business Partner (Customer/Vendor) data objectsEMPLOYEE TYPERegular

html: Job detailsSalary$74,000 - $96,000 a yearFull Job DescriptionYour JobThe Business Analyst - Revenue Systems role sits in the Internal Platforms team within Engineering, partnering with our customers to provide scalable, secure, resilient technology platforms that enable every team at Indeed to operate with maximum autonomy, effectiveness, and transparency. This specific role is part of the team responsible for the creation and support of Indeed’s global Revenue Systems, serving as the backbone for how we bill customers, handle taxation, receive payments, and recognize revenue. Some of our key stakeholders include Finance, Marketing, Sales, and Client Success.As a Business Analyst, you’ll work with various stakeholders at different levels of the organization to assess business needs, gather requirements, and help understand and improve work processes. You’ll need to provide diplomatic and timely communication in an agile-like work environment with iterative planning and delivery cycles. Specifically, you will:Gain in-depth knowledge of current processes and business practices through shadowing, interviewing key participants, and maintaining an understanding of the department(s) you support.Analyze, draft, validate and finalize business and technical requirements.Proactively examine the change impact of process adjustments on people, strategy, systems and general business operations to determine the priority of needs.Create User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Test Cases and facilitate UAT sessions.Assist with support of system changes/ implementation on an as-needed basis.Monitor and measure the effectiveness of processes post-implementation to ensure they continue to provide a positive impact on the team and are appropriate for the business.Engage with leadership to understand and refer to the vision, goals, and initiatives for your business area.Who You AreCharacteristics that set you apart:Excellent detective and highly curious.Detail-oriented, yet able to move forward efficiently in the face of unanswered questions.Continuously striving for process improvements.Leadership capabilities.Customer-focused and values end-user satisfaction.What we need from you:5 or more years of experience as a business analyst working with technical systems.Experience working closely with Finance stakeholders along with a strong working knowledge of accounting concepts and common Finance processes.Experience would include common back-end revenue cycle processes (Order Management, Billing, Taxation, Payments, Revenue Recognition) and related ERP/Billing systems.Core competencies in the creation of Business Cases, User Stories, and Workflow Diagrams. Additional competencies in the creation of Functional Requirements, data mapping, data modeling, and systems migrations are preferred.Must have a good knowledge of business process/lifecycle management principles, theories and concepts and a general understanding of industry practices, techniques, and standards.The ability to use independent judgment in identifying the root cause of problems, and developing solutions to a variety of problems of moderate to large scope and complexity.Good verbal and written communication and presentation skills to accurately document and report findings to a variety of audiences.Good interpersonal skills to influence and guide employees, managers, customers and other external parties.The ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information.Who we areWe are a rapidly growing and highly-capable Engineering organization building the most popular job site on the planet. With engineering hubs in Seattle, San Francisco, Austin, Tokyo, Singapore, Hyderabad, Dublin, Aberdeen and Vancouver, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job search at a time.Our MissionAs the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.(*comScore Total Visits, March 2020)Salary Range DisclaimerThe base salary range represents the low and high end of the Indeed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Indeed's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, long term incentives, an open Paid Time Off policy, and many region-specific benefits.Salary Range TransparencyUS Remote 74,000 - 96,000 USD per yearEqual Opportunities and Accommodations StatementIndeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. html: Job detailsSalary$45 - $48 an hourJob TypeFull-timeTemporaryFull Job DescriptionJob Description:Aquent is recruiting for a Data Analyst to support a major compensation initiative for our Fortune 100 Financial Services client in Dallas! Financial services background is preferred but not required. The ideal Data Analyst will have 3-5 years of experience working with data and specifically evaluating data for HR. The Data Analyst will be skilled in proficient with Microsoft Suite applications (Access, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint, Word) and exhibit intermediate to expert level in Excel.Strong math skills with ability to research complex questions and to conduct complex analysis of large data sets.The opportunity:Remote to start but we're looking for talent local to Chicago OR Dallas.12 month assignment with potential to extend and/or convert, 40 hours/week.Contract opportunities through Aquent offer best in class benefits including Medical/Dental/Vision, 401K, FSA and more.What you'll do:Performs support activities to assist in development, implementation and administration of compensation policies and programs, focusing initially on market pricing reviews and activities.Audits jobs using job descriptions for content reflecting job responsibilities, activities, duties and requirements.Reviews compensation surveys to collect and analyze competitive salary and incentive information for conformance to established guidelines, policies and practices and to determine company's competitive position.Works with the compensation team to formulate recommendations for new or revised company salary structures, FLSA exemptions, job revisions and organizational structures.Reviews existing and proposed statutory requirements governing compensation administration and recommends appropriate courses of action.May prepare special studies and recommendations on subjects such as job grades, salary ranges, geographic differentials, incentive compensation or bonus plans.What you'll have:College degree or equivalent experience preferred.3-5 years of experience in compensation or related field with emphasis on data analysis. Experience in Financial Services/Technology industries preferred.Incumbents should be proficient with Microsoft Suite applications (Access, Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint, Word) and exhibit intermediate to expert level in Excel.Strong math skills with ability to research complex questions and to conduct complex analysis of large data sets.Strong verbal and written communication skills.This role will initially be performed remotely. Incumbent should be comfortable working and communicating on a remote basis.Client Description:It’s not often that we get to say “yeah, but just listen to what they offer…” about our larger clients. Most people look at the awesome job description, then read “Financial Services Industry” and move on. We’ve heard it a thousand times! Know what else we’ve heard at this client just as much? “Wow! I’m so glad I took this job! This is not your father’s financial services company!”Work here and experience:Opportunities to work with cutting-edge digital business strategies & projectsHuge work-life balance cultureDiversity-focused workplaceStrong potential for temp-to-perm conversion (almost half of the people we've placed here have converted to a permanent position, either the one they're working in, or in a related department)Great Aquent community to work with onsite, including our bi-annual talent recognition program, which stems from the client managers’ own feedback (read: they’re engaged and interested in your future!)Don’t forget the massive points on your resume for being part of a cutting-edge team, leading the way in breathing fresh air into the financial services industryWith a customer experience focus in mind, our client is leading the way in the financial industry with their digital marketing & technology platforms. They recognize that today’s customers are technically savvy & independent as well as highly creative, and they’re working to be the best at serving them. We see this through how they are building platforms that allow customers to take ownership of their financial future, using video, animation, and social media to market to the end user. Their in-house digital agency has won numerous IHAF awards for their tools and cutting-edge technology. Working with this company, you would be working with groups and/or department such as an IHAF awarded digital agency, user experience, product development, communication strategy team and much more talented professionals like yourself. Come join us!

html: Your Opportunity:The Business Process Transformation team at Schwab is a cross-functional group that is helping to drive transformation across the firm. We use a variety of methodologies, tools and capabilities to drive large-scale change. Alongside our business and technology partners, we are responsible for protecting and safeguarding the assets of the firm and our clients while continuing to increase scalability, efficiency, and service experience.As a Business Analyst for our Smart Processing Ecosystem, you will play a critical role in identifying, prioritizing, and solving complex problems while partnering with business, technology and other stakeholders to deliver solutions that provide value for Schwab and our clients.Smart Processing requires an end-to-end solution for ecosystem strategy, vision, planning, and execution. When executed well, it drives tangible near-term benefits for Schwab and our clients, including greater scale via increased levels of automation and straight-through processing, greater transparency into service and operational processes, and more efficient and personalized service. Smart Processing also drives our long-term strategy through creation of data assets that will power AI and Machine Learning applications leading to even greater scale, personalization, and speed to market for Schwab’s next generation of products and features.What you haveThis role requires a highly motivated, organized, and experienced business-focused technology individual with a proven record of software delivery in a rapidly changing agile environment.Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering innovative and strategic business process requirements for software solutions deliveryAbility to articulate new product features and capabilities in clear use casesProficient user of JIRA and Confluence toolsSolid experience and understanding of Agile in developing epics, themes, user stories, supplementary requirements, and business rulesStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsBachelor’s degree, preferably in technical fieldExperience working in the financial services industry is a plusExperience in Pega 8.X and Pega LBA certification is a plusSQL, Python and/or Tableau skillset highly desirable but not mandatory for the role5+ years of experience in technical analysis or operations experience with an asset or investment management firm with a focus on data-related functions; highly preferredWhat you are good at:Partnering with a Product Owner to establish a vision and execution strategyGathering, documenting and validating requirements as user stories, translating functional requirements to technical requirements, and identifying scalable solutionsHighlighting product features and explaining user stories in a manner clearly understandable to the development teamCollaborating with cross-functional teams and end-users to create solutions that delight, deliver value, and are synergistic to product roadmaps and future-state visionWorking with leaders in communications, field integration, product development and the business to drive successful implementations of process redesign initiativesCoordinating development, testing, and implementation of solutions with vendors as neededMonitoring the progress of product development, and assisting with product release planning and testingIdentifying technology and design issues, coordinating team members and driving resolution across multiple teams and stakeholdersDemonstrating a pragmatic approach to product design and delivery; a ‘bias to action’ and a positive attitude when approaching complex situationsWhat you have:This role requires a highly motivated, organized, and experienced business-focused technology individual with a proven record of software delivery in a rapidly changing agile environment.Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering innovative and strategic business process requirements for software solutions deliveryAbility to articulate new product features and capabilities in clear use casesProficient user of JIRA and Confluence toolsSolid experience and understanding of Agile in developing epics, themes, user stories, supplementary requirements, and business rulesStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsBachelor’s degree, preferably in technical fieldExperience working in the financial services industry is a plusExperience in Pega 8.X and Pega LBA certification is a plusSQL, Python and/or Tableau skillset highly desirable but not mandatory for the role5+ years of experience in technical analysis or operations experience with an asset or investment management firm with a focus on data-related functions; html: The Technical Implementations Analyst provides support to the Implementations group and the organization. This position will assist with onboarding of customer business, for both new clients and add-on sites. This individual will work closely with an internal team, and all external clients and any necessary vendors. This position will ensure a smooth, on-schedule on-boarding experience helping to ensure quality and revenue continuity. This position will serve in a variety of roles, from data analyst and processor, to documentation lead, to client/site liaison, to project tracker and planner.Essential Job Functions:Facilitate execution of Business Associate agreements with third-party covered entities and business associates.Work closely with technical contacts at facilities to coordinate and ensure progress with billing data feed implementations.Review data supplied against requirements, identify issues, and provide clear feedback to parties.Communicate routinely with outside parties (hospitals, clients, vendors) regarding issues, and work toward resolutions.Complete setup of data flows with collection agencies.Prepare documentation of process specifics for Operations, as well as internal group documentation to support the team.Research and develop action plans for handling special processing rules and requirements in billing data feeds.Monitor new processes and coordinate with the team on resolution of any issues.Handle resolution of routine processing exceptions.Coordinate setup of remote access to facility systems for staff (resources, paperwork, training, logins).Stage practice profile data for billing system.Assist with support-related data capture matters as requested.Assist with quality review of various data captures and conversions, and provide follow-up as necessary to achieve resolution and/or task completion.Assist with general project tracking and completion of project documentation.Maintain confidentiality and protect trade secrets as required by HIPAA, and company policy.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Management maintains the right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.Required Skills:High proficiency with Microsoft Office applications.Ability to analyze and resolve complex issues.Very strong, interpersonal communication skills, verbal and written.Strong mathematical skills.Excellent reasoning ability, to think independently and exercise good judgment.Strong organizational skills to enable tracking and timely completion of all assignments.Ability to work well under pressure while handling multiple tasks with tight timelines.Ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines.Ability to work with minimal supervision.Demonstrated aptitude for learning, new technical concepts quickly and effectively.Commitment to excellence.Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Information Management, or equivalent experience.3 years experience with, and solid understanding of physician billing data flow and requirements.First-hand experience with physician billing on-boarding activities.Familiarity with HL7 content and data structure.Experience with communicating with physicians in a compose, professional manner.Understanding of project management principles and planning.Physical Demands: This is largely a sedentary role. This would require the ability to move and carry computers and paperwork, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.EEO Statement:ADVOCATE Revenue Cycle Management does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

html: Interested in a career with both meaning and growth? Whether your abilities are in direct patient care or one of the many other areas of healthcare administration and support, everyone at Parkland works together to fulfill our mission: the health and well-being of individuals and communities entrusted to our care. By joining Parkland, you become part of a diverse healthcare legacy that’s served our community for more than 125 years. Put your skills to work with us, seek opportunities to learn and join a talented team where patient care is more than a job. It’s our passion.PRIMARY PURPOSEThe individual in the Business Intelligence Specialist role is a project leader, recognizing timelines and priorities, and organizing the work efforts of both small initiatives and departmental improvements. The BI Specialist may be entrusted with resources and personnel to complete objectives without supervision.In general, the BI Specialist has reached a level of mastery across multiple disciplines in the data management field which allows the ability to see big picture consequences to make tactical decisions. The BI Specialist generally has a strong interest or specific advanced knowledge of a complex concept or tool that is critical for the department, and often serves as the top level technical expert in one of more highly specialized areas of systems analysis and reporting.The BI Specialist is expected to have strong time and project management skills, to have advanced speaking and communications skills, and to have the ability to think outside the box when designing solutions to both customer and departmental challenges. The BI Specialist proactively identifies areas of improvement within their scope of knowledge.The BI Specialist has attained a level of advanced knowledge or training to work independently not only on tasks assigned by supervisors, but also on problems outside the scope of daily work activities.MINIMUM SPECIFICATIONSEducation:Must have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or a related field.Masters preferred.Experience:Must have six years of experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools, including Crystal reporting, WEBi reporting and dashboards.Must have six years of SQL (Structured Query Language) server based SQL coding or Oracle PL-SQL (Procedural Language/Structured Query Language) experience.Must have a minimum of two years as a subject matter expert in a single reporting or data discipline.Prefer previous experience within a healthcare organization.Prefer previous experience with an Electronic Medical Record (EMR) application such as Eclipsys, Epic, Clarity, or Epic within a healthcare organization.Equivalent Education and/or Experience:May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements.Certification/Registration/Licensure:Prefer related certification(s) in Epic and/or Clarity.Prefer related certification(s) in SAP data reporting.Prefer related certification(s) in Cisco data management.Prefer Category I Project Management Professional (PMP) certification by the Project Management Institute (other project management training considered).Skills or Special Abilities:Must have an expert level knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language) / Oracle relational and multi-dimensional database structures, schemas, stored procedures, views, and queries.Must be able to build and run SQL queries, Crystal reports, and use other reporting tools.Must have an expert level knowledge of Reporting and Analytics.Must have expert level knowledge regarding EMR, word processing, database, and spreadsheet software.Must have an expert level knowledge of commonly used programming concepts, practices and procedures within the Information Technology field.Must have advanced knowledge of critical tools and concepts, and have the ability to explain these concepts to others on the team.Must have strong analytic and computer skills in addition to an extensive knowledge of database management and data analysis.Must be able to develop system specifications and decision flows, in the form of flow charts or equivalent techniques, from written business requirements.Must have experience with data modeling, warehouse design and virtual universe structures.Must be able to demonstrate critical thinking skills, with regard to system issues.Must demonstrate an understanding of patient data and the use of this data in a healthcare environment, as applicable.Must be able to accept verbal and/or written problems or direction from senior staff and business users and demonstrate an ability to prepare specifications that reflect provided information (with coaching from senior personnel).Must have exceptional planning skills with a results-oriented record of achievement and the ability to set goals, meet deadlines, and evaluate results particularly in regard to significant changes within an organization and with respect to the organization's relationship with the community or marketplace.Must have a high level of attention to detail, have the ability to manage multiple projects at once, and be able to demonstrate excellent analytical, organization and prioritization skills.Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills in order to interact effectively with customers, team members and IT management.Must be a quick learner. Good analytical and problem-solving skills.Must be able to work in a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.Must be able to demonstrate excellent time management skills and management reporting skills.Must be able to demonstrate excellent discernment and assessment in professional decision-making.Must be an independent worker and self-starter, having the ability to provide internal motivation and drive.Must set high standards of performance for self.Parkland Health and Hospital System prohibits discrimination based on age (40 or over), race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, disability, national origin, marital status, political belief, or veteran status.

html: Overview:As a Lead Business Analyst on the Intelligent Automation (IA) team, your initial focus will be scaling Chick-fil-A’s (CFA) Robotic Process Automation (RPA) enterprise practice throughout our organization. In this role, you will manage relationships with functional and technical partners to create capacity for Support Center Staff and reduce operational and project costs through process simplification and automation. As the liaison between the Intelligent Automation team and “automation champions” across CFA, you will lead this work with a team of internal Staff, Contingent Workers, and 3rd party vendors to design, implement, and support solutions using automation platforms. With the guidance of an IA Steering Committee and the support of an IA Center of Excellence, you will have significant autonomy to solve business problems and create end-to-end solutions. As our enterprise RPA capability matures and becomes operational, you will have the opportunity to expand the portfolio of automation solutions that you support.This is a professional-track role.Responsibilities:Serve as a trusted technology and process advisor to process owners at Chick-fil-A as the leader of the RPA program at CFAServe as an RPA and BluePrism “subject matter expert” html: About City of HopeCity of Hope, an innovative biomedical research, treatment and educational institution with over 6000 employees, is dedicated to the prevention and cure of cancer and other life-threatening diseases and guided by a compassionate, patient-centered philosophy.Founded in 1913 and headquartered in Duarte, California, City of Hope is a remarkable non-profit institution, where compassion and advanced care go hand-in-hand with excellence in clinical and scientific research. City of Hope is a National Cancer Institute designated Comprehensive Cancer Center and a founding member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network, an alliance of the nation’s leading cancer centers that develops and institutes standards of care for cancer treatment.Position SummaryThis position reports to the Senior Manager, Research Applications and Data Management and will routinely review and analyze Research Operations business process, workflow procedures, and job functions to provide insight and suggestions for improvements. Participates in related projects to develop business cases during project initiation and maintenance, identifies business needs and develops functional requirements and prototypes for system design, develops testing validation requirements for system testing, and assist in change management strategies for adoption of new systems or system changes throughout the project life cycle. Collaborate with multiple stakeholder groups including the Office of Sponsored Research (OSR), Clinical Trial Support Services (CTSS), Research Business Operations, Office of Foundation Relations (OFR), Office of Technology Licensing (OTL), Corporate Finance, and Information Technology Services (ITS).Key Responsibilities include:Business Process and System AnalysisUnderstand and monitor sponsored research business and system processes and how they are defined between various stakeholders.Understand system configurations and how to troubleshoot system issues, including configurations for OnCore.Proactively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following as needed: Business Case Analysis; Business Process Documentation/Work Flow Diagrams; Functional Requirements/Business Requirements Documentation; Functional Specifications; Use Cases, mock-up of GUI Screen and Interface designs.Understand the solution options that are available, guide project stakeholders, prioritize options based on merits, and recommend the best option.Submit helpdesk tickets related to research systems. Responsible for following-up on ticket submissions and will partner with ITS to ensure patches and fixes have been properly tested prior to installation to the production environment.Ensure that the OnCore system research users’ interests are known and communicated to other project stakeholders.Identify all the systems, processes and users that are impacted by the business problem, and/or the solution involved in the use of OnCore.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needsSystem and Sponsored Research AdministrationAct as first point of contact to troubleshoot and resolve system issues with stakeholders.Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.Coordinates, designs, facilitates and delivers training sessions for research system users.Prioritize production issues, enhancements, and projects with and amongst teams.Monitors routing and workflow to ensure proposals and awards are moving properly through InfoEd.Partner with the other members of the RADM team to support the institutional grant related reporting needs.QualificationsBasic education, experience and skills required for consideration:Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or relevant field is preferred.Relevant experience may substitute for minimum educational requirements.1 to 3 years of experience as a system support analyst and process improvement or change management systems analyst position in a non-profit organization is preferred.Knowledge of computer hardware, software, and programming languagesExperience in data analysis and systems evaluationPreferred education experience and skills:Computer Information Science or related fieldProficient in at least one high-level programming languagesExperience with SQL and/or Jasper ReportsExperience with clinical trial operationsExperience in an academic or research environmentCity of Hope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Associate Research Business Analyst

html: The MetroHealth System, Cuyahoga County’s public health system, and its staff of nearly 8,000 provides care at MetroHealth’s four hospitals, four emergency departments and more than 20 health centers and 40 additional sites throughout Cuyahoga County. The health system is home to Cuyahoga County’s most experienced Level I Adult Trauma Center, verified since 1992, and Ohio’s only adult and pediatric trauma and burn center. As an academic medical center, MetroHealth is committed to teaching and research. Each active staff physician holds a faculty appointment at Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine. Our main campus hospital houses a Cleveland Metropolitan School District high school of science and health. The MetroHealth System is committed to creating a healthier community.S ummary:Supports the evolving need of managing the outcomes for value-based payment agreements with respect to governmental risk-bearing population health initiatives, including but not limited to the Direct Contracting Entity and Accountable Care Organizations. The outcomes can be related to any of the triple aim expectations of these agreements including financial outcomes, patient experience outcomes, and clinical quality outcomes. The work involves connecting the outcomes and processes to MetroHealth efforts in population health and readiness for performing under shared risk and full risk reimbursement models. In addition to reporting directly to the Executive Director, will have a dual/matrixed relationship to the Director of Business Operations and Analytics in all matters related to increasing employee’s analytics skillset, obtaining analytics best practices, and collaborating with peer analysts within the Population Health Innovation Institute and Institute for H.O.P.E. Upholds the mission, vision, values, and customer service standards of The MetroHealth System.Responsibilities:1. Contributes to patient safety by supporting the System-wide programs and policies addressing a safe environment for patients and the reporting of safety concerns to the appropriate individuals.2. Assists and/or leads various finance, operations, strategic planning, and/or business development related projects and analysis within assigned Institute.3. Performs ad-hoc queries to investigate claims data and provide insights into trend, patterns and correlations in cost and utilization.4. Supports the establishment of data requirements and data integrity standards for the acquisition of external payer data.5. Maintains and updates proprietary data sources as needed.6. Designs data extracts and report presentations, including graphical and data visualization presentations.7. Cultivates a shared culture of analytic excellence grounded in collaborative problem refinement, self-directed learning, critical thinking, and supportive, interdisciplinary teamwork.8. Performs outcomes reporting, trend analysis, data modeling and data mining of claims data.9. Provides research, analysis and recommendations on the external environment as part of the development of organizational business plans, population health initiatives, accountable care organization initiatives, and capitation payment models.10. Develops and supports appropriate financial and risk models for population health initiatives.11. Develops and prepares various analytic and statistical reports to support various organizational needs.12. Creates and manages standard dashboards for multiple organizational layers (i.e. CEO, COO, clients, network physicians, and participants), including internal and external stakeholders.13. Evaluates profitability and pricing on specific services offerings and develops standard performance indicators to enable analysis of current and new service lines.14. Displays sensitivity to and understanding of various cultural, ethnic, racial, and socioeconomic backgrounds.Qualifications:Required:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or related major or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience in addition to the experience stated below.Demonstrated actuarial proficiency or one to five years of progressive financial analytical experience in healthcare.Highly proficient in MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word.Foundational knowledge of relational database structures.Experience with SAS/SQL or similar programming languages.Strong analytical, critical thinking, forecasting, communication skills (verbal and written).Working knowledge of healthcare data and inter-related nature of coding nomenclatures (e.g. DRG’s, CPT’s, etc.).Experience requesting and extracting data from healthcare information systems.Demonstrated ability to manipulate and analyze data derived from disparate sources.Beginner to intermediate knowledge of healthcare utilization review, revenue cycle, cost allocating and their impacts on financial and strategic performance.Ability to take abstract thoughts or ideas, hone them into an analytical plan, and support leadership-ready reports.Ability to interact effectively with a wide range of cultural, ethnic, racial, and socioeconomic backgrounds.Preferred:Experienced in project valuation, statistical significance testing, business case analysis and development.Prior Epic experience.Experience with data visualization programs like Tableau.Knowledge of artificial intelligence, machine learning, or deep learning methods.Experience with statistical modeling/testing and regression analysis.Experience with a large healthcare hospital system (public system highly desirable).Physical Demands:May need to move around intermittently during the day, including sitting, standing, stooping, bending, and ambulating.May need to remain still for extended periods, including sitting and standing.Ability to communicate in face-to-face, phone, email, and other communications.Ability to read job related documents.Ability to use computer.IND#
title: Strategic Data Analyst Population Health Innovation Institute

html: General Purpose/Scope:The Healthcare Analyst position will be responsible for providing timely and accurate analyses of healthcare data within the Integra Data Warehouse as well as other internal and external data sources. These analyses will be used for the evaluation of operational, managerial, and QI processes as well as the creation of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The Healthcare Analyst will also monitor, analyze, and communicate aggregate and regional metrics against benchmarks where applicable.Responsibilities Include:Supports business initiatives through data analyses, identification of implementation barriers, and user acceptance testing of new systems.Works closely with IT to ensure data completeness, data accuracy, and data availability.Retrieves, compiles, reviews, and ensures accuracy of data from data warehouse and other constructed databases and researches and corrects discrepancies, as needed. Analyzes data from internal and external sources. Acts proactively to identify and fix data quality issues before reports/analyses are generated.Creates and summarizes large volumes of data in analytical reports that include tables, graphs, statistical analyses, and qualitative and quantitative analyses. Analyzes data using tools such as SAS, MS Access, MS Excel, etc. to create statistical outputs associated with reports. Reviews and identifies trends and variances in data and reports.Conducts reactive and proactive ad hoc analyses to better understand the business and to provide information to senior management, health plan management, and external organizations, including the Department of Health, IPRO, etc. Provides narrative interpretation to clarify findings as needed.Assists in the development of analysis plans, which includes documenting analyses methodology, protocols, and design. Researches, recommends, and implements efficient means of data collection, maintenance and analysis.Provides analytical/administrative support to leadership in the development of department workflows, project plans, policies and procedures.Reviews and identifies trends and variances in data and reports. Researches findings and determines appropriateness of elevating identified issues to leadership for further review/evaluation/actionPerforms special projects and other duties, as needed.Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Public Health, Healthcare Informatics, Health Administration, Statistics, or other relevant discipline required.Minimum 3 years of increasingly responsible data analysis/reporting experience in a healthcare setting required.Advanced proficiency in personal computer programs including:MS Excel (including formulas, sorts, filters, pivot tables, IF statements, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, etc) requiredMS Access (criteria statements, table links, and database and report creation) preferredEffective oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills required.Knowledge of MLTC and Medicare Advantage analytics preferred.Knowledge of SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Base programming required.Integra is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination or harassment based on any characteristics protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.If this opportunity sounds exciting and challenging to you, please click “Apply” now!IND123

Currently, in our stores and Corporate offices, we're practicing social distancing, wearing face coverings (subject to certain exemptions), cleaning frequently, and following state and local requirements as well as Center for Disease Control (CDC) guidelines to help ensure a clean and safe environment for all.
